Choice Scarf.description:
• Ditto is a niche revenge killer that can also be used to attempt a reverse sweep, but it must be wary of threats that may counter it with a surprise Terastallization, such as Tera Fairy Miraidon, Tera Fire Koraidon, Tera Ice Iron Bundle, and Tera Water Gholdengo.
  • Ditto doesn't add much value to teams on its own outside of helping overwhelm opposing checks. It is also strongly prediction reliant.
  • Maximum bulk and minimum Speed allow Ditto to force opposing Ditto to trigger Imposter first and run out of PP quicker.
  • Tera Fairy defeats Choice Scarf Miraidon, Koraidon, and Walking Wake that may try to attack it with a Dragon-type move.
  • Ditto is rarely a reliable check for reasons explained earlier, so it appreciates support from backup checks, especially for potent threats that it fails to revenge kill such as Swords Dance Chien-Pao, Double Dance Miraidon, and Bulk Up Great Tusk. Thus, teammates like Toxapex, Skeledirge, Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Iron Treads are good picks.
  • Ditto's ability to revenge kill many strong threats makes teambuilding flexible, allowing offensive Pokemon like Miraidon, Iron Bundle, Chien-Pao, and Koraidon to fit more easily.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Mewtwo is a niche wallbreaker by courtesy of its access to Nasty Plot and usable Speed stat letting it outspeed Pokemon like Arceus and most Eternatus variants. Its ability to dismantle common defensive Pokemon, like most Arceus formes, and discourage Pokemon like Zacian-C from switching in, makes it a very hard Pokemon to deal with defensively.
  • However, Mewtwo's Speed stat leaves it outsped by common Pokemon like Zacian-C, Koraidon, Miraidon, and Flutter Mane, all of which can heavily damage, if not outright OHKO, it.
  • Grass Knot hits Mewtwo's biggest roadblock in Ting-Lu for massive damage.
  • Flamethrower retains the hit on Zacian-C and Tera Steel Clodsire for big damage while also damaging other Tera Steel Pokemon like Giratina-O.
  • Taunt allows Mewtwo to stop Defog attempts from the likes of Giratina-O and Corviknight while also denying recovery attempts from Skeledirge and Arceus formes. Moreover, Taunt also permits Mewtwo to antilead Ribombee and deny its Sticky Web, being one of the few Pokemon that can accomplish this without losing an important chunk of HP in the process.
  • Earth Power can be used instead to greatly damage Zacian-C, Skeledirge, and tera Steel Pokemon like Clodsire.
  • Tera Steel allows Mewtwo to resist both of Zacian-C's STAB moves while also resisting Extreme Killer Arceus's Extreme Speed, which is particularly important, as Extreme Killer Arceus is a very common offensive answer to Mewtwo.
  • Heavy-Duty Boots allows Mewtwo to ignore entry hazards like Spikes and, most importantly, Toxic Spikes. Leftovers can be used instead as Mewtwo's only form of recovery. Lastly, Life Orb can be used to greatly increase Mewtwo's damage output, allowing it to have a favorable chance of OHKOing Ting-Lu after a Nasty Plot. A Modest nature can be used to ensure Mewtwo OHKOes Ting-Lu and Extreme Killer Arceus at +2 and works best on Sticky Web teams, as on them Mewtwo doesn't mind the loss in Speed and can break holes in teams more easily.
  • It is advised to get Mewtwo on the field via smart double switches or U-turn from teammates like Koraidon, as per its underwhelming defensive typing, it doesn't get many opportunities to freely switch in. Once in the field, Mewtwo should dish out as much damage as possible or use Nasty Plot to break important Pokemon, like Calm Mind Arceus formes. Against faster foes without pivoting moves like Zacian-C, Mewtwo can freely Terastallize into a Steel-type to resist both of its STAB moves and hit back hard with an Earth Power or Flamethrower.
  • Mewtwo struggles against faster foes, like Zacian-C, Koraidon, and Flutter Mane. Because of this, Pokemon like Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Clodsire make for good partners. Landorus-T and Clodsire in particular help Mewtwo by spreading entry hazards, allowing it to net some KOs that it would normally miss, such as against Arceus-Steel, a Pokemon that now gets OHKOed by a +2 Flamethrower after a single layer of Spikes.

Choice Specs.description:
• Choice Specs Mewtwo is a strong and decently fast wallbreaker that crucially outspeeds Arceus. Its power and coverage give Mewtwo the ability to OHKO or 2HKO just about every Pokemon in the tier.
  • However, Mewtwo can easily be revenge killed by Miraidon and Koraidon, both of which outspeed and threaten a KO on it after Stealth Rock.
  • Psystrike capitalizes on the lack of Psychic-resistant foes, as even Zacian-C struggles to take more than two Psystrikes. It also helps against Calm Mind Arceus, especially Tera Poison variants.
  • Ice Beam hits Pokemon like Giratina-O and Tera Flying users like Zacian-C. Mewtwo can use Tera Fire to resist Tera Flying Zacian-C's STAB moves and OHKO it with Ice Beam after minimal chip damage.
  • Flamethrower hits Zacian-C and Tera Steel users. Koraidon's sun can ensure the OHKO on Zacian-C as well as 2HKO on max HP Arceus.
  • Grass Knot is mainly used for hitting Mewtwo's worst enemy, Ting-Lu. It also hits Arceus-Ground, Kyogre, and Groudon much harder than Ice Beam, potentially scoring OHKOes if they run more offensive spreads.
  • Tera Fire gives Mewtwo useful resistances against common revenge killing options like Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's STAB moves. If sun is active, Tera Fire Flamethrower can 2HKO bulky foes such as Clodsire and Koraidon.
  • Choice Specs Mewtwo's most important partner is Koraidon, usually with Choice Scarf. Koraidon helps power up Mewtwo's Flamethrower and lures in Mewtwo's favorite targets such as bulky Arceus formes and other physical checks.
  • Defensive partners like Clodsire, Ting-Lu, Skeledirge, Gliscor, and Landorus-T are appreciated to check threats like Miraidon, Koraidon, and Zacian-C.
  • Miraidon and Calm Mind Arceus variants appreciate Mewtwo's effectiveness at breaking through specially bulky Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Clodsire, Iron Treads, and defensive Arceus formes.

Defensive.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Pink Blob (Specially Defensive).description:
• Blissey functions as an blanket check to special attackers on balance and stall teams, being especially useful against hard-to-check special threats such as Calm Mind Miraidon, Chi-Yu, Iron Bundle, and Walking Wake.
  • Seismic Toss is Blissey's only way to reliably deal damage to most opposing Pokemon, while Shadow Ball is able to do decent damage to Flutter Mane.
  • Thunder Wave is extremely useful to cripple common switch-ins such as Koraidon and can also find use against Flutter Mane and Terastallized Miraidon.
  • Blissey is a reliable setter of Stealth Rock, which can free up moveslots on Great Tusk and Iron Treads, but you should note that opposing Great Tusk and Iron Treads as well as Corviknight have little difficulty clearing entry hazards on Blissey.
  • The Tera Type is quite flexible. Tera Ground is very useful against Calm Mind + Parabolic Charge Miraidon sets, as it completely negates their recovery and allows Blissey to force out them out.
  • Tera Fire gives Blissey the ability to better take on Chi-Yu, with Heavy-Duty Boots negating the Stealth Rock weakness.
  • Tera Ghost provides a Fighting-type immunity and allows Blissey to switch out of Dugtrio and Gothitelle.
  • Solid defensive walls such as Skeledirge, Great Tusk, Dondozo, Scream Tail, and Dachsbun are good teammates to take on physical attackers like Koraidon that commonly come in on Blissey.
  • Blissey is not capable of handling all Miraidon sets on its own, so Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Iron Treads are heavily recommended teammates. In turn, these Ground-types have less pressure on them to stay healthy and can focus more on setting entry hazards.
  • Care should be taken against Miraidon and Iron Bundle, which often use pivoting moves or Taunt to gain momentum on Blissey. Proper prediction with Blissey's teammates may be required to handle this.
  • As a result, Rocky Helmet is an option, as it does damage to U-turn, Flip Turn, and Electro Drift users, making Miraidon and Iron Bundle unable to pivot on Blissey for free. If running Rocky Helmet, make sure you have plenty of Pokemon that can deal with entry hazards, such as Corviknight, Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Hatterene.
  • Flutter Mane is difficult for Blissey to reliably check due to Taunt and Psyshock sets, so Corviknight and Garganacl can help pick up the slack. In return, both appreciate Blissey being a safe switch-in to Iron Bundle.

Offensive.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Kyogre is a solid form of speed control found on bulky offense teams. Its ability to outspeed Zacian-C and pressure common Pokemon found on bulky archetypes, like Ting-Lu, Corviknight, Skeledirge, and Groudon, gives it a decent offensive presence. Choice Scarf Kyogre can also pressure hyper offense teams because those teams don't run Pokemon naturally faster than it. However, Choice Scarf Kyogre is prediction reliant, as there are a lot of Pokemon that resist Water-type attacks in Ubers, mainly metagame staples like Koraidon, Miraidon, and other defensive Pokemon like Water Absorb Clodsire and Eternatus. Choice Scarf Kyogre is also relatively weak, which means that it'll often be forced to use Tera to power up its attacks; even then, Pokemon like Eternatus and Clodsire will still wall Kyogre.
  • Koraidon is the biggest threat to Kyogre, as it commonly switches into it, takes little damage from its Water-type attacks, and sets sun. Catching Koraidon with Ice Beam is extremely important, as it can make the difference between Kyogre sweeping in the late-game or not. This makes Choice Scarf Kyogre extremely prediction reliant, as one single bad move can mean the entire momentum of the battle is lost.
  • Tera Water boosts Kyogre's Water-type moves to insane levels. For instance, Water Spout now OHKOes max HP Arceus formes that are neutral to Water and 2HKOes Arceus formes that resist Water. It also has a good chance to OHKO Groudon even if sun is active.
  • Kyogre should be brought onto the field via pivoting moves like U-turn from the likes of Koraidon, Miraidon, and Landorus-T. Unless there are Water Absorb Pokemon on the enemy team, Water Spout is a relatively free move to spam; however, hitting Koraidon on the switch with a well-timed Ice Beam can be game-changing.
  • Choice Scarf Kyogre appreciates Pokemon that can wallbreak by themselves. A good teammate for this reason is Miraidon, which shares a common check in Clodsire. Taunt Miraidon in particular can shut down Clodsire completely, as Clodsire will be at half HP after switching into Draco Meteor. Miraidon can also bring Kyogre onto the field via U-turn. Arceus-Ground is another great teammate for Kyogre, as it can keep Pokemon like Eternatus, Clodsire, and Miraidon in check.
  • Pokemon that can check Koraidon, like Arceus-Fairy, Groudon, and Skeledirge, are a must, as Koraidon is one of the most annoying Pokemon in Ubers for Kyogre to deal with: it replaces rain with sun, weakening Kyogre's main attacking moves. They can also set entry hazards and, in Landorus-T's case, bring Kyogre onto the field with U-turn.
  • Entry hazard removers like Giratina-O and Corviknight are appreciated, as Kyogre loses a lot of power when its HP is lowered. Both Pokemon also check threats like Extreme Killer Arceus, which can revenge kill Kyogre with Extreme Speed.

Choice Specs.description:
• Choice Specs Kyogre is a devastating wallbreaker that can OHKO or 2HKO the entire metagame. However, the ever-present sun set by Koraidon and its relatively low Speed make it harder to use than it may appear, even with its incredible power.
  • Water Spout gives Kyogre the power to OHKO even resistant Pokemon such as Miraidon and Eternatus when paired with Tera Water, and it lets Kyogre claim KOs with ease early on. Ice Beam lets Kyogre hit Koraidon and Clodsire super effectively, cleanly OHKOing the former lacking bulk EVs and 2HKOing the latter. Thunder is Kyogre's strongest option for breaking through bulky Water-types such as Toxapex, Arceus-Water, and opposing Kyogre.
  • Tera Water lets Kyogre perform feats such as OHKOing Miraidon, Toxapex, Arceus-Water, and Eternatus with Water Spout or Origin Pulse with a layer of Spikes up.
  • An alternate EV spread of 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Def can be used to take on Arceus formes and switch into defensive Pokemon such as Skeledirge and Landorus-T better.
  • Kyogre fits well on bulky offense. It has trouble getting onto the field and loses a significant part of its power if it takes a hit, so it should be paired with pivots such as Koraidon, Miraidon, and Landorus-T. They can bring Kyogre in on their incoming checks such as Arceus-Fairy and Skeledirge, Arceus-Ground, and Ting-Lu, respectively.
  • Kyogre also greatly appreciates entry hazard removal, such as Defog support from Giratina-O and Corviknight, which keeps Water Spout at full power. Speed control options help Kyogre to wallbreak to its fullest, as it tends to have to take a hit before attacking thanks to its lower Speed, such as Thunder Wave from Arceus, Miraidon, Giratina-O, and Groudon, and Sticky Web from Masquerain.
  • Entry hazards support from Ting-Lu and Clodsire is also appreciated to make sure Kyogre's attacks can cleanly OHKO most of their switch-ins. The aforementioned two Pokemon are also able to check Miraidon and Eternatus, both of which can come in on Kyogre and revenge-kill it. Koraidon can force Kyogre out and can switch into its Water-type attacks, so checks to Koraidon such as Skeledirge, Landorus-T, Great Tusk, and Arceus-Fairy are also appreciated. That said, Kyogre can also predict Koraidon coming in and catch it with an Ice Beam, which is a clean OHKO on all Koraidon without bulk EVs.
  • Kyogre can also be used as a solid offensive check to Arceus formes, as it can pivot into a Taunt or a Calm Mind and force them out with a strong Origin Pulse or Water Spout. Kyogre can also pivot into opposing Calm Mind Kyogre, forcing it out with Thunder.

Bulky Calm Mind.description:
• Thanks to Kyogre's naturally high bulk, it can use Calm Mind to set up on defensive Pokemon such as Ting-Lu and Skeledirge, as well as Pokemon it forces out through its typing, such as Zacian-C and Koraidon.
  • Surf is the move of choice thanks to its higher PP as well as accuracy over Origin Pulse. Ice Beam lets Kyogre hit Miraidon, Koraidon, Eternatus, and Clodsire super effectively, which would otherwise freely switch into Kyogre. Tera Blast can be used if paired with Tera Ground to break through Clodsire, regardless of whether it has used Tera.
  • Substitute can be used to set up on Clodsire, which cannot break it with Earthquake, and avoid status in general. Rest lets Kyogre repeatedly come in and absorb status, though it must be wary of Miraidon's Hadron Engine setting Electric Terrain.
  • Tera Fairy flips Kyogre's matchup against Eternatus and Koraidon, letting Kyogre freely come in on Dragon-type moves and resist Koraidon's STAB attacks. Tera Ground lets Kyogre set up on Miraidon's Electro Drift, although it cannot take Draco Meteor well without previously having set up. Tera Poison is another option for becoming immune to Toxic from Clodsire, Toxapex, and Eternatus while also resisting Koraidon's Fighting-type attacks.
  • Leftovers provides Kyogre with a form of recovery and gives it more chances to enter the field.
  • The given EV spread lets Kyogre take on physical attackers like Groudon and Koraidon better while outspeeding some paralyzed +1 Arceus formes and paralyzed Zacian-C.
  • Kyogre fits best on balance and bulky offense teams thanks to the defensive utility it provides as well as being a solid late-game wincon.
  • Miraidon is a great partner for non-Rest variants of Kyogre, as it can break through Taunt and Calm Mind Arceus formes and pressure bulky Water-types such as Toxapex and Arceus-Water. Miraidon can also use U-turn to bring Kyogre in on Ground-types that it can set up on, such as Ting-Lu and Clodsire. Ting-Lu and Groudon are solid partners for Kyogre, since they can set up Spikes to weaken Kyogre's checks, while also being able to switch into Electric-type attacks that threaten Kyogre. Physical attackers such as Groudon, Arceus-Ground, Chien-Pao, and Koraidon pair well with Kyogre, as they can use Kyogre's checks as an entry for them to start breaking, and Kyogre pressures all of their checks apart from Arceus-Water.
  • Kyogre needs Koraidon eliminated before it can start setting up, as Kyogre is generally forced out by it and its STAB moves are weakened. As such, defensive Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Great Tusk, and Arceus-Fairy are solid partners that check Koraidon effectively. Finally, Kyogre has trouble coming in against faster offense teams, so partners that can pressure these teams such as Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Zacian-C are preferred.

Offensive Calm Mind.description:
• Offensive Calm Mind Kyogre is a decent setup sweeper on offensive and balance teams for its ability to punch big holes in defensive cores for its team to exploit.
  • Ice Beam allows Kyogre to threaten Dragon-types like Koraidon, Miraidon, and Eternatus, which can withstand Kyogre's STAB attacks. Koraidon is a noteworthy target, because it can otherwise easily oppose Kyogre’s rain with its sun. Ice Beam also hits Clodsire, which otherwise completely walls this Kyogre set without Tera Ground Tera Blast.
  • Kyogre can easily spread paralysis with Thunder Wave thanks to it naturally forcing out Ground-types, which is appreciated by slower teams.
  • Thunder lets Kyogre smack defensive Water-types that resist Surf and Ice Beam, like Toxapex and Dondozo, as well as lays waste to opposing Kyogre. It also hits Pokemon that may Terastallize into a Water-type, like Eternatus and Zacian-C.
  • With Tera Ground, Tera Blast can 2HKO Clodsire without setting up, even if it is Terastallized into a Steel-type, while also hitting Toxapex. However, it has very little practical use outside of this.
  • Kyogre has no reliable recovery, so Heavy-Duty Boots is the preferred item so it doesn’t get worn down by entry hazards. Leftovers can be used on teams that have reliably hazard control like Giratina-O.
  • Tera Fairy gives Kyogre a Fighting resistance and Dragon immunity, making it impossible for Koraidon to threaten Kyogre in rain.
  • Tera Poison gives Kyogre a Fighting resistance and immunity to Toxic, and also allows it to absorb Toxic Spikes from Eternatus, Toxapex, and Clodsire.
  • Tera Ground gives Kyogre an Electric immunity, letting it avoid Electro Drift from Miraidon and Thunder from opposing Kyogre.
  • Tera Grass, on the other hand, gives Kyogre Ground and Electric resistances, letting it set up on Pokemon it otherwise cannot, like Groudon, Arceus-Ground, and Miraidon.
  • This Kyogre set is a good fit on balance teams that struggle against defensive teams, as it is a bulky setup sweeper that can take advantage of common defensive Pokemon like Skeledirge and Ting-Lu to spread paralysis with Thunder Wave.
  • Zacian-C is a fantastic partner, able to threaten many Pokemon commonly used to threaten Kyogre without a Substitute, like Koraidon and Miraidon. Zacian-C also loves Kyogre’s rain neutering its Fire weakness.
  • Koraidon can pivot into Kyogre with U-turn while taking attacks used against Kyogre, like opposing Koraidon’s Flare Blitz when Kyogre is Terastallized and Miraidon’s Electro Drift. Koraidon also loves Kyogre threatening physical checks like Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Groudon.
  • Clodsire lures like Choice Specs Miraidon are great for Kyogre, as Kyogre is completely walled by Clodsire that has Terastallized into a Steel-type if it doesn't have Tera Ground Tera Blast.

Defensive.description:
• Thanks to Groudon's excellent physical bulk, it soft checks numerous physical threats in the tier such as Arceus, physical variants of Arceus-Ground, Koraidon, and Zacian-C.
  • 16 EVs in Speed allow Groudon to outspeed uninvested Kyogre, Giratina-O, and Landorus-T. Alternatively, a spread of 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD can be used to maximize Groudon's bulk.
  • Precipice Blades is a powerful STAB option that OHKOes Zacian-C and Miraidon and has a chance to OHKO Eternatus, whereas Earthquake is a weaker STAB option that offers greater accuracy.
  • Will-O-Wisp cripples physical threats Groudon switches into such as Arceus, Koraidon, and physical variants of Arceus-Ground.
  • Spikes helps chip down switch-ins for the rest of the game due to the limited distribution of hazard removal in the tier. Alternatively, Stealth Rock can be used for the same purpose but Spikes is recommended as it hits all targets neutrally.
  • Groudon tends to struggle against special wallbreakers such as Miraidon and Flutter Mane, so Protect is a great option to scout for a potential Choice item and increase its Leftovers recovery. Alternatively, Bulk Up can be used to beat physical setup sweepers such as Swords Dance Arceus formes and Koraidon.
  • Leftovers is mandatory on Groudon, since it does not have any reliable recovery.
  • Tera Fairy gives Groudon an immunity to Dragon-type attacks from the likes of Miraidon, Eternatus, and Koraidon.
  • Tera Water lets Groudon resist Zacian-C's STAB Behemoth Blade, Calyrex-I's STAB Glacial Lance, and Koraidon's sun-boosted Fire-type attacks.
  • Due to Groudon being unable to reliably check physical threats long-term, it’s best to have some form of speed control such as Choice Scarf Koraidon or a reliable wall such as Skeledirge alongside it.
  • Breakers such as Miraidon and Flutter Mane really appreciate Groudon's ability to reliably set both sun, which boosts their Fire-type attacks, and Spikes, which allows them to wallbreak more effectively. Koraidon also has great synergy with Groudon as they both set sun. It also appreciates Spikes support from Groudon.

Swords Dance.description:
• Swords Dance Groudon is a threatening wallbreaker that is able to pressure defensive Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu.
  • Crunch is chosen as the primary coverage move to hit Giratina-O super effectively and also hit Corviknight neutrally. Spikes and Stealth Rock make progress against the switches Groudon forces, but Fire Punch is another option that breaks through Corviknight while also synergizing with Drought and Tera Fire.
  • The given EV spread outspeeds uninvested Giratina-O, Kyogre, and Landorus-T while maximizing bulk and damage output. An alternate spread with 252 Atk / 4 Def / 252 Spe and a Jolly nature can be used on Sticky Web teams as a sweeper.
  • Lum Berry can be used to get past Will-O-Wisp users like Arceus and Giratina-O, though this cuts into Groudon's longevity.
  • Tera Ground boosts Groudon's Precipice Blades to absurd levels, letting it OHKO even bulkier variants of Arceus at +2. Tera Fire lets Groudon avoid Will-O-Wisp entirely and powers up Fire Punch but makes it susceptible to being revenge killed by Arceus-Ground and opposing Groudon. Tera Fairy is an option to become immune to Miraidon's and Giratina's Draco Meteor, but the other Tera types are generally preferred thanks to their offensive power.
  • Groudon is best used on bulky offense as an offensive entry hazard setter that can come in on slower Pokemon such as Clodsire, Skeledirge, and Ting-Lu and use them as setup fodder. Groudon forces switches thanks to its power, so use these chances to aggressively set hazards or use Swords Dance.
  • Miraidon is a great partner for being able to pivot Groudon into Clodsire and Ting-Lu while also being able to pressure Groudon's checks like Giratina-O and Corviknight. The two Pokemon also share a check in Arceus-Ground, which they can overwhelm. Koraidon is a similarly good partner for sharing a check in defensive Arceus-Fairy, which they can overwhelm together. Koraidon also can U-turn into Groudon on incoming Skeledirge, which Groudon can use as an opportunity to set hazards or force a defensive Terastallization. Utility Arceus-Fairy can form a hazard stacking core with Groudon while also helping check Giratina-O, Koraidon, and Miraidon. Finally, Arceus-Water, Clodsire, and Eternatus are solid partners, as they all check Kyogre, which cannot switch into Groudon repeatedly but can threaten it out.

Dragon Dance.description:
• With Dragon Dance, Rayquaza serves as a threatening late-game sweeper with the ability to boost its already sky-high Attack and fix its issue with Speed.
  • Heavy-Duty Boots is generally the preferred item thanks to nullifying Rayquaza's otherwise bad weakness to Stealth Rock, but Life Orb enables Rayquaza to perform ridiculous feats like guaranteeing an OHKO on Zacian-C after a single boost.
  • Tera Flying further strengthens Rayquaza's already spammable Dragon Ascent, letting Life Orb Rayquaza crush bulky teams. At +1, Life Orb Tera Flying Dragon Ascent has good odds to 2HKO even the most physically defensive Corviknight.
  • Tera Fire gives Rayquaza a valuable resistance to Fairy, letting it set up on Zacian-C, Arceus-Fairy, and Flutter Mane, while also letting it become immune to Will-O-Wisp from Groudon and Skeledirge.
  • Extreme Speed allows Rayquaza to revenge kill weakened foes in a pinch, most notably Scale Shot Koraidon, Miraidon, and Extreme Killer Arceus.
  • Substitute allows Rayquaza to block status-inducing moves like Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge and Toxic from Clodsire, Toxapex, and Gliscor. It is generally not worth using with Life Orb because the combination cuts too much into Rayquaza's already awful longevity.
  • Draco Meteor allows Rayquaza to beat Skeledirge and the rare Dondozo solo without Terastallizing. However, it has little practical use outside of this.
  • A Naive nature should only ever be run when Rayquaza runs Draco Meteor. Jolly is the preferred nature in all other scenarios.
  • Dragon Dance Rayquaza is best used on hyper offense teams that love its ability to punch big holes into bulky teams for its teammates to exploit late-game. Rayquaza is not much of a defensive presence, but it can be used to check dangerous Ground-types like Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground without sacrificing offensive output.
  • Zacian-C forces out or baits Terastallization from Fairy- and Dragon-types that threaten Rayquaza, like Koraidon, Miraidon, and Arceus-Fairy, while being a ferocious offensive threat in its own right. Thus, it is an invaluable partner for Rayquaza.
  • As Dragon Dance Rayquaza fits mainly on hyper offense teams, it should be paired with hyper offense leads like Glimmora and Meowscarada.
  • Physical attackers that appreciate Rayquaza's ability to punch great holes into their checks are good partners for it, as they are made more dangerous late-game with their checks weakened. These include Extreme Killer Arceus, Scale Shot Koraidon, and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground.

Swords Dance.description:
• Swords Dance Rayquaza functions as a strong wallbreaker and a potential revenge killer or late-game cleaner thanks to Extreme Speed. Dragon Ascent is Rayquaza's go-to move with which it can 2HKO Skeledirge, Giratina-O, and most Arceus formes.
  • Earthquake is a valuable coverage move that allows Rayquaza to hit Flying-resistant foes like Zacian-C and Miraidon for massive damage.
  • Swords Dance allows Rayquaza to turn the aforementioned 2HKOs into OHKOs and 2HKO Corviknight with Dragon Ascent.
  • Extreme Speed allows Rayquaza to pick off weakened targets or even sweep with the combination of Tera Normal and Swords Dance. After a Swords Dance, Tera Normal Extreme Speed can OHKO even Koraidon and Miraidon.
  • Life Orb is crucial for this set because it gives Rayquaza the necessary power boost to score OHKOs and 2HKOs that it needs to.
  • Jolly is necessary because it allows Rayquaza to get the jump on foes like the plethora of base 90 Speed Pokemon such as Kyogre as well as suicide leads such as Glimmora. On Sticky Web teams it's even more important because Adamant Rayquaza can't outrun -1 Speed Zacian-C.
  • Swords Dance Rayquaza fits on more offensive teams where it can switch in on defensive Ground-types such as Landorus-T, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire. Rayquaza pairs exceptionally well with Sticky Web setters such as Ribombee, as they let it outspeed Zacian-C, previously faster Arceus formes, and non-Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon, which can all be OHKOed after a Swords Dance.
  • Rayquaza also pairs well with Extreme Killer Arceus and Kingambit because together they form a priority core that gives their team a very reliable safety net against common sweepers like Koraidon and Miraidon. Rayquaza also appreciates Taunt users like Miraidon and Arceus because they can prevent foes from setting up hazards or healing to try to stay out of range of Rayquaza's attacks.

Suicide Lead.description:
• Rayquaza has a niche as a suicide lead over other Pokemon like Glimmora thanks to its base 150 Attack and Special Attack stats. This allows it to beat other common leads like the aforementioned Glimmora, as Draco Meteor ignores Toxic Debris, and Ribombee while also threatening other Pokemon, mainly physically bulky Pokemon like Landorus-T that are annoying to its teammates.
  • Unfortunately for Rayquaza, the prevalence of Taunt Arceus hinders its ability to consistently lay down entry hazards. Furthermore, Scale Shot Koraidon is very common and is an effective anti-lead that beats Rayquaza. Other Pokemon like Zacian-C also take advantage of Rayquaza not being able to hit it with a super effective move and heavily threaten the opposing team. Lastly, Calm Mind variants of Arceus are bulky enough to utilize Rayquaza as setup fodder and freely boost themselves without much threat.
  • Draco Meteor with maximum Special Attack investment allows Rayquaza to lure in and 2HKO common physical walls, such as Landorus-T, Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Groudon.
  • Tera Fairy allows Rayquaza to be immune to Dragon-type attacks, with the most notable example being Scale Shot from Koraidon; this gives Rayquaza an opportunity to deal huge damage on Koraidon without sacrificing HP or abilities on important teammates like Zacian-C's Intrepid Sword. However, it's not entirely advised to Terastallize immediately, as it must be saved as an emergency option only.
  • Rayquaza is a suicide lead that must prioritize setting entry hazards while dealing damage if the situation presents it. Other common hyper offense leads, like Ribombee and Glimmora, lose the one-on-one against Rayquaza, which means that only dedicated teams with Pokemon like Taunt Arceus and dual screens Grimmsnarl can beat and annoy Rayquaza.
  • Rayquaza fits best on hyper offense teams with teammates that appreciate Stealth Rock being set and physically bulky Pokemon being heavily damaged. As a result, Koraidon, Zacian-C, and physical Arceus formes are good teammates. Zacian-C in particular helps Rayquaza against Scale Shot Koraidon, one Pokemon that can outright OHKO Rayquaza even through Focus Sash. Flutter Mane is another Fairy-type Pokemon that can help with Scale Shot Koraidon while also dealing with the Taunt Arceus formes that annoy Rayquaza and its team. Rayquaza cannot prevent Pokemon like Ribombee and Glimmora from getting their own entry hazards up; therefore, Pokemon that can remove them, like Great Tusk and Iron Treads, are good partners.

Mixed Attacker.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Lead.description:
16 Speed EVs allow Deoxys-S to outspeed Zacian-C, Miraidon, and Koraidon.

These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Defensive Pivot.description:
• Gliscor is a great pivot in Ubers thanks to its many positive traits. Poison Heal grants it excellent passive recovery and a status immunity, meaning that it can sit on Pokemon like non-Ice Beam Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, Groudon, Clodsire, Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Ting-Lu, after its Toxic Orb has been activated. Its excellent bulk lets it tank hits from and trade hits with metagame beasts like Zacian-C and Koraidon, with Protect giving Gliscor the ability to scout moves and stay healthy throughout the game. Lastly, its very useful Ground immunity lets it annoy common Ground-type Pokemon like Groudon and Landorus-T while also being Spikes-immune.
  • Unfortunately for Gliscor, its low base Special Defense means it gets exploited and forced out by many common special attackers, namely Kyogre, Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Calm Mind Arceus formes. The aforementioned Zacian-C and Koraidon can also overwhelm Gliscor after a Swords Dance, forcing it to Terastallize to not succumb to their attacks. Lastly, Gliscor's offenses are mediocre, meaning that Taunt Pokemon like Arceus formes and Koraidon can effectively shut it down, as they take very little damage from Earthquake.
  • Gliscor is a good user of Spikes, as it commonly annoys most Defog and Rapid Spin Pokemon, such as Giratina-O and Great Tusk, with Toxic. Corviknight stands out as the only Pokemon that is immune to Toxic, is immune to Earthquake, and can stall out Spikes with Defog and Pressure.
  • Knock Off can be used instead to cripple Pokemon like Landorus-T, Kyogre, and Ting-Lu, as well as opposing Gliscor if it doesn't use Protect before its Toxic Orb has been activated. Knock Off can also cripple Heavy-Duty Boots Pokemon like Eternatus, and it is best used with Pokemon that can lay Spikes, like Ting-Lu and Clodsire, both of which appreciate Gliscor's ability to cripple and wear down hazard removal Pokemon like Giratina-O. However, with Arceus formes everywhere in the tier, which can absorb Knock Off without losing their items, Knock Off is usually unable to cripple most Pokemon. Nonetheless, said Arceus formes still fear Toxic from Gliscor.
  • Lastly, Taunt is also an option for Gliscor to deny entry hazard attempts from slower Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, opposing uninvested Gliscor, and Clodsire while also denying recovery from Arceus formes and Clodsire on the switch.
  • The given spread lets Gliscor outspeed uninvested base 100 Speed Pokemon. The remaining EVs maximize bulk, allowing Gliscor to avoid the 2HKO and OHKO from Zacian-C's +1 and +3 Behemoth Blade, respectively.
  • Another possible EV spread is 244 HP / 80 Def / 140 SpD / 44 Spe with a Careful nature. This makes Gliscor able to survive an unboosted Ice Beam from support Arceus formes from full, letting it use Toxic on them. This can come in handy, as support Arceus formes can be an annoyance to the teams Gliscor usually sees play in. However, this spread leaves Gliscor 2HKOed and OHKOed by a +1 and +3 Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C, respectively, and OHKOed by +2 Scale Shot from Koraidon.
  • Tera Water lets Gliscor resist the Water- and Ice-type attacks that are commonly thrown at it such as Ice Beam from Arceus-Ground, Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I, and Kyogre's moves. Tera Water also allows it to resist Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade and Koraidon's Flare Blitz, which is equally important. However, Terastallizing leaves Gliscor unable to switch into Ground-type Pokemon like Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground. Furthermore, it makes Gliscor become affected by Spikes and take super effective damage from Miraidon's Electro Drift instead of being immune to it.
  • Gliscor wants to activate its Toxic Orb as soon as possible in order to continuously be able to check and switch in on threats, so it is advised to quickly get it in the field and use Protect to ensure it gets poisoned. Gliscor is an annoyance for teams that have multiple physical attackers like Koraidon and Zacian-C, so its HP should be preserved in order to comfortably tank their hits. However, Gliscor should not be the only switch-in to the aforementioned Pokemon, as it can get overwhelmed fairly easily, due to them commonly running Swords Dance.
  • Gliscor's Special Defense is on the lower side, with Pokemon like Calm Mind Arceus formes, Miraidon, Kyogre, and Eternatus taking advantage of this to wreak havoc with powerful attacks or, in Eternatus's case, threaten to set Toxic Spikes. Because of this, Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Water Absorb Clodsire are recommended teammates. Pokemon like Arceus-Water and Kyogre can take on the Ice-type attacks that OHKO Gliscor while also helping it not get potentially overwhelmed by Koraidon and Zacian-C.

Physical Utility.description:
• Giratina-O is a very potent offensive presence in Ubers thanks to its powerful attacks, superb bulk, and passable Speed stat that lets it outspeed common defensive pieces like Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and most Landorus-T and Gliscor variants. Levitate grants it an invaluable immunity to the ever-present Spikes, allowing it to work as a wallbreaker that demands other kind of counterplay, like the less common Stealth Rock.
  • However, Giratina-O gets outsped by the entirety of the offensive metagame. While strong, Giratina-O doesn't achieve any notable OHKOs, thus many common Pokemon like Landorus-T, Zacian-C, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Koraidon can pivot around it with relative ease. Giratina-O might also be forced to Terastallize to perform its role as a utility Pokemon due to the relevance of Toxic Pokemon like Clodsire and Gliscor, as well as the existence of faster threats like Zacian-C, Koraidon, Miraidon, and Flutter Mane. Terastallizing is a huge commitment, and Giratina-O more often than not is doing it to be able to perform consistently. Lastly, Giratina-O has a big longevity issue, which can make it struggle in checking the Pokemon it's supposed to, making it fit only on certain styles of teams that can make up for its non-existent recovery with teammates like Wish Alomomola.
  • Thunder Wave can help Giratina-O spread paralysis for itself and its teammates, giving it a form of speed control. With the given EV spread, Giratina-O can take a hit from Zacian-C and potentially paralyze it, which is game-changing. However, it's not a common occurrence, as Giratina-O must be at full HP to accomplish this. Thunder Wave is also unable to paralyze common switch-ins to Giratina-O like Ting-Lu and Landorus-T. As a result, another option to run is Will-O-Wisp, which completely ruins Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, and Clodsire, while also annoying other switch-ins, namely Arceus formes like Fairy.
  • Shadow Sneak gives Giratina-O a tool to revenge kill Flutter Mane, Tera Ghost Pokemon like Koraidon, and low HP targets like Zacian-C. If this is not needed, however, Giratina-O can effectively run Defog thanks to its positive matchup against common entry hazard setters.
  • The given EV spread permits Giratina-O to live one Play Rough from +1 Zacian-C from full HP. It also gives Giratina-O very favorable chances to avoid the 2HKO from Ice Beam from non-Choice Specs Kyogre. The Speed allows Giratina-O to outspeed uninvested Gliscor, and the remaining EVs are slotted into Attack so that Giratina-O always 2HKOes Zacian-C with Poltergeist.
  • Tera Steel allows Giratina-O to check Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, Zacian-C, and Flutter Mane. It also lets Giratina-O annoy Arceus-Fairy one-on-one and beat Calm Mind Arceus-Ground while making it immune to Toxic from the likes of Gliscor and Clodsire. Tera Poison can be used instead, as it still gives Giratina-O a Fairy-type resistance and poison immunity, but it also gives a new resistance to Fighting that can let it take on Koraidon. This, however, leaves Giratina-O unable to check Zacian-C and resist Dragon-type attacks.
  • Giratina-O fits best on bulky offense teams that need a way to deal with Ground-type Pokemon like Arceus-Ground and Groudon and can't afford to run passive checks to them like Corviknight. Once on the field, Giratina-O can make use of its powerful STAB moves to hit everything in the tier at least for neutral damage; however, be aware that Poltergeist has only 8 PP, meaning that while it's Giratina-O's main way of dealing damage, it should not be used recklessly, as it can get PP stalled with smart pivoting, especially by teams that have Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Extreme Killer Arceus.
  • Giratina-O is forced out by common Pokemon like Zacian-C, Koraidon, and Miraidon. It can also be overwhelmed by very strong Ice-type attacks from the likes of Calyrex-I and Choice Specs Kyogre. Pokemon like Kyogre can help Giratina-O against Calyrex-I and Koraidon, while the likes of Clodsire can help against Miraidon. Other Pokemon like Skeledirge and Arceus-Fairy can help Giratina-O against Zacian-C and Koraidon, respectively. Lastly, Pokemon that can help against Ting-Lu, like Arceus-Fairy and Gliscor, are also good teammates, as Ting-Lu's Ruination threatens to put a severe dent in Giratina-O's HP, and Ting-Lu can freely use Spikes against Giratina-O.

Special Utility.description:
• Giratina-O is Ubers' only offensive Defogger. Its combination of superb bulk, typing, and stellar offensive traits allows it to punish every entry hazard setter in the format, including, but not limited to, Ting-Lu, Clodsire, Landorus-T, some Arceus formes like Arceus-Water, and Gliscor. Giratina-O's Ground immunity gives it excellent opportunities to switch in on the ever-present Spikes, which allows it to act as somewhat of a wallbreaker that also happens to give Defog support, as most defensive teams will only have said Spikes as way of dealing with wallbreakers, which Giratina-O is immune to.
  • However, Giratina-O's strongest attack is Draco Meteor; this makes Giratina-O prone to be taken advantage by setup sweepers like Tera Fairy Miraidon, Zacian-C, Kyogre, and Flutter Mane. Hex is also a very weak move if the foe is not statused, meaning that Giratina-O will not be attacking for the majority of the early- to mid-game and instead, it'll be spreading status conditions and using Defog. Lastly, Giratina-O's poor Speed leaves it outsped by the likes of Koraidon and Arceus formes.
  • Will-O-Wisp spreads status to empower Hex and annoy Pokemon like Clodsire, Ting-Lu, and most Arceus formes that will regularly be switching into Giratina-O.
  • The given EV spread allows Giratina-O to avoid being 2HKOed by any of Kyogre's attacks without Stealth Rock while outspeeding 0 Speed Gliscor. The remaining EVs maximize Special Attack for Giratina-O to hit as hard as possible.
  • Tera Steel allows Giratina-O to check Pokemon like Flutter Mane. It also lets Giratina-O annoy Calm Mind Arceus formes while making it immune to Toxic from the likes of Gliscor and Clodsire. Tera Fairy can be used instead for Giratina-O to become immune to the Dragon-type attacks that will be aimed at it from Koraidon, Miraidon, and opposing Giratina-O.
  • Giratina-O fits best on bulky offense teams that need a way to battle Ground-type Pokemon like Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground and Groudon, and also need a hazard removal Pokemon. If using Defog is not needed, Giratina-O can instead spread status with Will-O-Wisp and launch Draco Meteors to dent Pokemon like Ting-Lu.
  • Giratina-O wants to be paired with physical attackers like Koraidon, Zacian-C, Arceus-Ground, and Calyrex-I that can deal with the walls that annoy it. In return, Giratina-O can deal with the physically bulky Pokemon, like Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Landorus-T, that annoy them. Clodsire and Ting-Lu are good teammates as well, as they take on Pokemon that Giratina-O can't, like Miraidon and Choice Specs Kyogre in Clodsire's case.

Extreme Killer (Swords Dance).description:
• The combination of Swords Dance and STAB Extreme Speed turns Arceus into a deadly setup sweeper.
  • Shadow Claw hits Giratina-O and Skeledirge hard, especially if Arceus has Terastallized into the Ghost-type.
  • Taunt denies opposing recovery and blocks status moves such as Will-O-Wisp from Giratina-O and Skeledirge, but Recover can let Arceus acquire multiple boosts, making it nigh unstoppable.
  • Earthquake hits Toxapex and Zacian-C hard while doing respectable damage to Skeledirge.
  • A Silk Scarf lets Arceus secure important benchmarks such as OHKOing offensive Kyogre at +2 with Extreme Speed. Alternatively, Leftovers offers more longevity, while Lum Berry offers extra insurance against status effects.
  • The given EV spread and nature maximize Arceus's damage output and let it outspeed Adamant Rayquaza, with the rest of the EVs going into HP to facilitate setup.
  • Tera Normal boosts Extreme Speed to absurd levels, letting Arceus OHKO offensive Koraidon at +2 if holding a Silk Scarf.
  • Alternatively, Tera Ghost is useful for preventing Koraidon and Zacian-C from revenge killing it. It also boosts Shadow Claw against targets such as Giratina-O and Skeledirge.
  • Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to burn, which is helpful against Skeledirge and Giratina-O.
  • Swords Dance Arceus is a good fit on hyper offense and bulky offense, working best as a late-game sweeper when checks such as Corviknight, Zacian-C, and Skeledirge are weakened or removed. With Extreme Speed, Arceus also serves as an emergency check to opposing sweepers.
  • Good teammates for Arceus include Zacian-C, Groudon, and Koraidon, which share similar checks such as Corviknight and Skeledirge and can wear them down for Arceus to sweep.

Dragon Dance.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Arceus to outspeed opposing Arceus formes as well as turn the tables on faster Normal-resistant or immune Pokemon such as Zacian-C, Flutter Mane, Arceus-Ghost, and Tera Ghost Pokemon.
  • Extreme Speed is a powerful priority move that lets Arceus revenge kill opposing sweepers as well as clean weakened teams late-game.
  • Shadow Claw OHKOes Flutter Mane and hits Giratina-O, Skeledirge, and foes that have Terrastalized into the Ghost-type hard, especially if Arceus has Terastallized into the Ghost-type itself.
  • Flare Blitz is a powerful coverage move that OHKOes Zacian-C at +1 and deals heavy damage to Corviknight and Tera Steel Giratina-O. Earthquake has no recoil and also has a good chance to OHKO Zacian-C at +1 after Stealth Rock, but it cannot hit Corviknight. Recover keeps Arceus healthy throughout a match and potentially lets it set up more than once.
  • Silk Scarf is recommended to boost the power of Extreme Speed to secure benchmarks such as OHKOing offensive Kyogre at +1 with Tera Normal. Leftovers is another good option, especially alongside Recover, to let Arceus accrue multiple boosts. Lum Berry is useful for giving Arceus additional insurance against status moves such as Will-O-Wisp from Giratina-O or Skeledirge.
  • The given EV spread maximizes Arceus's damage output while giving it enough Speed to outrun max Speed base 90 Pokemon, as well as uninvested Koraidon and Miraidon.
  • Tera Normal with a Silk Scarf gives Extreme Speed the extra power needed to OHKO Miraidon and offensive Kyogre at +1 after Stealth Rock. However, Tera Ghost is also an option to boost the power of Shadow Claw and avoid being revenge killed by Koraidon and Zacian-C. Finally, Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to Will-O-Wisp.
  • Arceus fits best on hyper offense and bulky offense, where it keeps opposing sweepers in check with its powerful priority while threatening to sweep itself.

Calm Mind.description:
• Thanks to the combination of Fairy- and Ground-type attacks, which has excellent neutral coverage, Arceus-Fairy is a very strong Calm Mind user.
  • Arceus-Fairy's powerful Fairy-type Judgment discourages Ting-Lu from coming in, giving it a niche compared to other Calm Mind Arceus formes.
  • With Earth Power and the given Special Attack investment, Arceus-Fairy can 2HKO Leftovers Clodsire at +2 and 2HKO Skeledirge outright.
  • The Speed investment is used to outspeed base 90 Speed Pokemon, while the rest is dumped into HP and Defense. This allows Arceus-Fairy to be a utility switch-in to Dragon-types and physical attackers in general, and it works well with Calm Mind's Special Defense boost.
  • An alternative EV spread of 108 HP / 148 SpA / 252 Spe with a Timid nature still lets Arceus-Fairy 2HKO Clodsire at +2 whilst having maximum Speed to have a better matchup against opposing Arceus with Taunt. Do note that the loss of physical bulk makes taking on Clodsire, Koraidon, and Zacian-C much more difficult.
  • Either Tera Poison or Tera Steel is critical to prevent Clodsire and Eternatus from landing a Toxic on Arceus-Fairy. Tera Poison has the additional benefit of absorbing Toxic Spikes and gives Arceus-Fairy fewer weaknesses than Tera Steel, so it is generally preferred. Tera Steel can be useful against Zacian-C, and it also can be used as a backup option against Cresselia thanks to the Stored Power resistance it provides.
  • Arceus-Fairy works fantastically on a countless number of balance teams, as not only does it provide a strong wincon, but it is one of the few Pokemon to have a Dragon-type resistance in the tier, making it a good backup check to Koraidon and Miraidon. Its general physical bulk and good Special Attack also allows it to be a good burn absorber against Groudon and Giratina-O.
  • While Arceus-Fairy can damage Zacian-C on the switch with Earth Power, Zacian-C's strong Behemoth Blade is the greatest obstacle for Arceus-Fairy to overcome. As a result, solid Zacian-C checks like Skeledirge, Groudon, Toxapex, and Corviknight are recommended partners.
  • Giratina-O can provide Defog and status support, and in return, Arceus-Fairy can provide a Dragon-type resistance and take on Dark-types such as Ting-Lu, Urshifu-S, and Arceus-Dark.

Utility.description:
• Arceus-Fairy is one of the best Stealth Rock users in the metagame thanks to its good matchup against common entry hazard removers in Ubers like Giratina-O, Corviknight, and Great Tusk. Arceus-Fairy also has a positive matchup against opposing entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu and Groudon, as it can comfortably deny entry hazards thanks to Taunt. Taunt also allows Arceus-Fairy to deny entry hazards from Pokemon like Clodsire that, by virtue of their typing and bulk, would have no problems setting them up against it.
  • Arceus-Fairy can also run options like Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave over Stealth Rock, giving it a way to punish Pokemon like Zacian-C and Clodsire even harder as they switch into it.
  • The given spread allows Arceus-Fairy to outspeed threatening Pokemon like Arceus and Palkia-O without a Speed-boosting nature. The remaining EVs are used to maximize physical bulk, which can let Arceus-Fairy better switch into attackers like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Chien-Pao. Another option is to run max Speed, which gives Arceus-Fairy a better matchup against opposing Calm Mind Arceus formes. However, the loss of bulk is very noticeable.
  • Tera Water allows Arceus-Fairy to have a better matchup against not only Fire-type moves like Flare Blitz from Tera Fire Koraidon, but also Ice-type Pokemon like Calyrex-Ice and Chien-Pao. It also turns Arceus-Fairy's Steel-type weakness into a resistance, which can come in handy against Zacian-C, especially if Arceus-Fairy is running a status move.
  • Arceus-Fairy will be regularly switching in, as thanks to its good typing and stats it can, at the very minimum, soft check Pokemon like Koraidon. Koraidon needs to use Tera Fire in order to beat Arceus-Fairy one-on-one, which in general is a positive trade for Arceus-Fairy's team.
  • That being said, Arceus-Fairy appreciates teammates like Skeledirge, Groudon, and Toxapex, as they also check Koraidon and can help Arceus-Fairy against other threats like Zacian-C. Groudon in particular is a good teammate, as it forms an hazard-stacking combination with Arceus-Fairy.
  • Pokemon with access to Taunt like Miraidon and Koraidon are also good teammates for Arceus-Fairy, as they can, combine with it to shut down walls like Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Toxapex and win the entry hazard game.
  • Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Clodsire can also provide entry hazard support for Arceus-Fairy while checking Pokemon that can overwhelm it like Miraidon, and, in Clodsire's case, Flutter Mane and Eternatus.

Bulky Calm Mind.description:
• Arceus-Fairy is one of the best setup sweepers in the tier thanks to its very good bulk, typing, access to utility moves like Will-O-Wisp that discourage common Arceus-Fairy checks like Zacian-C from switching into it, and STAB move that nothing is immune to. What differentiates Arceus-Fairy from other Calm Mind Arceus formes is its Dragon immunity, which grants it an invaluable defensive niche against some of the metagame's top threats, like Koraidon, and its Judgment being at least a neutral hit on the vast majority of the metagame, as Pokemon that resist Fairy are scarce.
  • The given EV spread allows Arceus-Fairy to outspeed Adamant Rayquaza while maximizing bulk. This allows Arceus-Fairy to avoid the 2HKO from Pokemon like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Jolly Life Orb Rayquaza.
  • Tera Poison is essential to prevent Clodsire and Eternatus from poisoning Arceus-Fairy with Toxic; it also allows Arceus-Fairy to absorb Toxic Spikes. It also retains Arceus-Fairy's ability to check Fighting-type attacks from the likes of Koraidon in a pinch, which can be useful for pivoting. In conjunction with Will-O-Wisp, Tera Poison Arceus-Fairy can potentially take on Zacian-C one-on-one if it has enough Calm Mind boosts.
  • Arceus-Fairy should be spreading Will-O-Wisp before attempting to sweep, as Pokemon like Clodsire and Zacian-C can stop Arceus-Fairy on its tracks before it accomplishes anything. Arceus-Fairy can be overwhelmed fairly easily by strong powerhouses like Tera Fire Koraidon and Choice Specs Miraidon, so taking care of them first before attempting to sweep is advised.
  • Skeledirge is the best counter to Arceus-Fairy, as it ignores Calm Mind boosts with Unaware, can break through it with Torch Song, and is naturally immune to Will-O-Wisp. Because of this, Pokemon like Eternatus, Kyogre, Miraidon, and Clodsire are good teammates, as they can comfortably sit on Skeledirge and force it out.
  • Pokemon like Skeledirge can check Zacian-C and Koraidon for Arceus-Fairy and spread burns with Will-O-Wisp; the combination of Skeledirge + Arceus-Fairy checks Koraidon pretty well. Similarly, Landorus-T can act as a soft check to Koraidon and Zacian-C that can also provide both entry hazard and Taunt support. Pokemon that can check special attackers for Arceus-Fairy, like Ting-Lu and Clodsire, are recommended, as they also can set up entry hazards on the field for Arceus-Fairy to have an easier time sweeping late-game.

Dragon Dance.description:
• Dragon Claw is used to hit Giratina-O while also giving you coverage for other Ground-immune foes. On the other hand, Gravity bypasses the need for super effective coverage to hit Ground-immune Pokemon such as Corviknight and is commonly paired with Tera Ground. Flare Blitz paired with Tera Fire can be used to hit Tera Steel Giratina-O and Flying-types such as Corviknight. Ice Beam is an option to heavily damage Landorus-T and Gliscor, who would normally sit on Arceus-Ground. Lastly, Extreme Speed can be used to revenge kill potentially faster threats such as Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon while also giving you fast priority attack against threats like Chien-Pao and Arceus-Normal.
  • Taunt works better on offensive teams to block Will-O-Wisp or recovery attempts from Pokemon like Skeledirge, while Recover usually benefits from being on a more balanced build, allowing Arceus to have more defensive utility and check threats such as Miraidon and Zacian-C.
  • While using Recover on your moveset you should consider using bulkier spreads that benefit from the longevity for more defensive utility or easier setup opportunities; for example, a spread of 248 HP / 144 Atk / 48 SpD / 68 Spe can work for this purpose.
  • Tera Fire is mainly used to absorb Will-O-Wisp without relying on Taunt, freeing up a moveslot; it also helps against Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade and Play Rough.
  • Tera Ground gives Arceus-Ground an immense power boost to Earthquake, which allows it to OHKO Koraidon, Palkia-O, and Mewtwo, 2HKO defensive Groudon with a boost, and threaten to OHKO bulky Kyogre variants and Calm Mind Arceus after a boost and entry hazard damage.
  • Tera Fairy aids in the Miraidon matchup by making it immune to Draco Meteor while also giving a solid defensive typing that benefits from specially bulkier spreads.
  • Ground-immune Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Giratina-O, and Corviknight and bulky walls like Giratina and Dondozo are its best answers, so Arceus-Ground appreciates teammates that can threaten them like Miraidon, Kyogre, and Eternatus.
  • Other physical attackers like Zacian-C, Rayquaza, Koraidon, Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I help Arceus-Ground by threatening damage on their checks and allowing a later sweep by Arceus-Ground on a weakened foe.

Calm Mind.description:
• Calm Mind enables Arceus-Ground to set up and become a strong cleaner that sweeps through most teams with a largely unresisted Ground-type STAB Judgment while being able to better take hits from Miraidon.
  • Ice Beam allows Arceus-Ground to hit Giratina-O, Arceus-Grass, and Corviknight, which can otherwise force it out.
  • Arceus-Ground's Special Attack investment allows it to OHKO Skeledirge, as well as OHKOing Zacian-C after a Spike. The bulk allows for it to take two Flare Blitzes from Jolly Koraidon, while the Speed investment outruns neutral-natured base 90 Speed Pokemon such as Kyogre and Groudon.
  • Tera Fairy allows Arceus-Ground to be immune to Koraidon and Miraidon's Dragon-type moves and prevents Giratina-O from phazing it with Dragon Tail but comes at the expense of now being OHKOed by Zacian-C.
  • Tera Water allows Arceus-Ground to set up in front of Kyogre and comfortably survive a Flare Blitz from Koraidon, but this does come at the expense of becoming weak to Miraidon's Electro Drift.
  • Arceus-Ground is best used alongside Pokemon that reliably weaken Ting-Lu and Kyogre, such as Choice Specs Miraidon and Mewtwo. It also appreciates partners that can weaken Kyogre, such as Koraidon, Kyogre, and Zacian-C.
  • Defensive teammates such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, Corviknight, Kyogre, and Eternatus can help check Koraidon, Kyogre, and Zacian-C, which Arceus-Ground can struggle with prior to getting a Calm Mind up.
  • Arceus-Ground is best saved for the end game, ideally once the opponent's Tera has been revealed or their Koraidon has been removed, as it is the most reliable revenge killer to Arceus-Ground after a Calm Mind. It can get setup opportunities against most Arceus formes that are not carrying Taunt; defensive Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Corviknight; and Miraidon.
  • While this set can be overwhelmed by fast offensive threats such as Koraidon and Zacian-C, it is still one of the premier threats in the tier and can quickly snowball out of control if its handful of checks such as Ting-Lu and Kyogre get chipped throughout the course of the game.
  • Arceus-Ground can afford to drop its Defense or Special Attack investment and run more Speed if it wishes to try to outrun opposing Arceus formes that are running Taunt.

Choice Item.description:
• Shadow Tag Gothitelle can trap most defensive Pokemon, paving the way for its teammates to sweep.
  • Trick facilitates trapping defensive walls like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk by locking them into an unfavorable move. Psychic targets Great Tusk and Toxapex, while Psyshock helps Gothitelle trap Clodsire better. Thunderbolt allows Gothitelle to trap Corviknight if it's not running U-turn or has a Choice item. Grass Knot KOes Great Tusk, Dondozo and hits Ting-Lu hard. Taunt is used to limit phazing attempts and Choice locked status moves, forcing the trapped Pokemon to use Struggle.
  • Rest allows Gothitelle to more effectively PP stall foes and remain healthy.
  • Choice Specs Gothitelle plays a more offensive role, aiming to rack up KOs. On the other hand, Choice Scarf variants are more likely to use Trick to beat opposing walls.
  • 32 HP and 4 Defense EVs allow Gothitelle to avoid being 2HKOed and 3HKOed from Ting-Lu's and Clodsire's Earthquake, respectively. 220 Speed EVs allow Choice Specs variants to outspeed defensive Great Tusk and Annihilape and Choice Scarf variants to outspeed offensive Great Tusk.
  • Gothitelle usually uses its Tera type to trap and beat Choice locked foes it otherwise would not trap; Tera Fairy beats Miraidon and Koraidon Choice locked into Dragon moves, Tera Water tanks Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Iron Bundle's Ice Beam, and Tera Flying avoids Earthquake from Ting-Lu and Great Tusk.
  • Gothitelle's favorite partners are powerful sweepers and cleaners such as Miraidon, Koraidon, Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, Kingambit, and Chien-Pao, all of which appreciate Gothitelle removing one or more of their checks.

Delay Goth (Trapper).description:
• This Gothitelle set aims to trap and PP stall weak walls so that its offensive teammates can take over mid- to late-game. This Gothitelle set can come in on weak walls like Clodsire, Ting-Lu, Alomomola, and defensive Great Tusk and beat them by PP stalling them.
  • Charm and Calm Mind are use to boost Gothitelle's survivability while PP stalling its foe.
  • Taunt is used to stop phazing attempts and make the trapped Pokemon use their attacking PP, thus depleting their PP faster. Stored Power is an alternative for teams that benefit from having more wallbreaking potential or that have a good matchup against the Dark-types of the tier like Chien-Pao and Kingambit.
  • The 24 Speed EVs allow Gothitelle to be faster than uninvested Corviknight, trapping it if it's not running U-turn. The Defense investment is used to tank hits well for PP stalling purposes, with attacks such as Ting-Lu's Earthquake being only a 4HKO.
  • Tera Fairy is used for its solid defensive typing and ability to trap Choice-locked Dragon-types like Miraidon and Koraidon, Tera Water is an option for its overall great defensive typing, granting resistances to Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, Koraidon's Flare Blitz, and Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump or Ice Beam. Lastly, Tera Ground is used to allow Gothitelle to trap Miraidon locked into an Electric move or defeat Double Dance sets one-on-one.
  • Gothitelle's favorite partners are powerful sweepers and cleaners, especially setup sweepers that take advantage of defensive Pokemon having their PP drained to set up easily and without risk. Common examples include Swords Dance Koraidon, Swords Dance Chien-Pao, Double Dance Miraidon, and Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

Physically Defensive.description:
• Alomomola is a bulky pivot against physical attackers such as Koraidon and Chien-Pao on balance or defensive teams.
  • The decision between Play Rough and Chilling Water depends on your preference. Play Rough is important since it provides actual damage against Chien-Pao and Koraidon; on the other side, Chilling Water is an effective stop to Bulk Up Great Tusk and bulky Palafin, which otherwise are annoying Pokemon to deal with for defensive teams.
  • Whirlpool is a better support option than Light Screen on more defensive teams, since its continuous damage and trapping allow Alomomola to break past some Pokemon, such as Ting-Lu. On the other hand, Light Screen is better for offensive teams, since it helps them switch against powerful special attackers such as Miraidon and Flutter Mane without sacrificing a Pokemon.
  • Besides healing Alomomola with Protect, Wish helps its teammates not get worn down, especially walls without reliable recovery like Dondozo, Ting-Lu, and Great Tusk.
  • The item choice depends on your team structure. If you have good entry hazard removal and need more damage against threats, then Rocky Helmet is the best choice. Leftovers is useful when you have good hazard removal but can also inflict good damage with your teammates; it also prevents some 2HKOs, for example from Choice Band Chien-Pao's Crunch. Without good hazard removal, Heavy-Duty Boots is the preferred choice.
  • Run a Relaxed nature with Play Rough, or if you have Chilling Water + Whirlpool and wish to sacrifice some Speed for full Whirlpool damage. Otherwise, run Bold.
  • Tera Fairy provides Alomomola with Fighting and Dark resistances, letting it switch in more comfortably and stop setup from Koraidon and Chien-Pao. Additionally, the Dragon immunity lets it sponge hits such as Koraidon's Dragon Claw and Outrage, or Draco Meteor from Miraidon.
  • Special walls work well alongside Alomomola's physical defense, such as Ting-Lu, Clodsire, Blissey, and Corviknight.
  • Other great partners are Toxapex and Dondozo, as Alomomola relieves pressure on them to check threats such as Koraidon, Chien-Pao, and Great Tusk. Dondozo is especially helpful here due to its Unaware ability. Unfortunately, you also stack weaknesses against common special attackers such as Miraidon and Iron Bundle; this should be considered while teambuilding.

Mixed Dragon Dance.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Defensive.description:
• Thanks to Intimidate and its useful typing, defensive Landorus-T is a good temporary measure against threatening physical attackers like Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus-Ground.
  • Rocky Helmet is the preferred item for punishing the use of contact moves from Pokemon like Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus-Ground, giving Landorus-T a better chance to beat them one-on-one.
  • However, Leftovers grants Landorus-T passive recovery, allowing it to somewhat offset Stealth Rock damage.
  • Tera Fairy gives Landorus-T an immunity to Scale Shot from Koraidon, allowing it to deny Koraidon a Speed boost and potentially allow a teammate like Koraidon or Zacian-C to revenge kill the opposing Koraidon. Tera Fairy also has the added benefit of making Landorus-T immune to Draco Meteor, potentially allowing it to turn the tables on Miraidon.
  • Tera Water lets Landorus-T better take Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C and Flare Blitz from Koraidon, potentially allowing it to beat them with higher HP than normal, as well as possibly allowing it to check Calyrex-I.
  • Defensive Landorus-T is best used on bulky offense teams as a mid-game stopgap against physical threats, which lets its offensive teammates take advantage of them later in the game.
  • Landorus-T is commonly used on teams that stack physical attackers and need a temporary measure against dangerous threats like Zacian-C and Arceus-Ground. Pokemon like Scale Shot Koraidon, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Zacian-C are good partners, as they appreciate Landorus-T's ability to stave off threats and preserve their HP.
  • Ting-Lu is a fantastic partner, as it can switch into Pokemon Landorus-T cannot hope to stand up to, like Miraidon and various Calm Mind Arceus formes. Ting-Lu also doubles down on Landorus-T's Stealth Rock with its own Spikes, making its offensive teammates even more threatening later in the game.
  • Kyogre is also a great partner, as it can threaten Pokemon that can give Landorus-T trouble or take advantage of its presence, like Calyrex-I, Gliscor, and opposing Landorus-T.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Landorus-T is a decent Choice Scarf user thanks to its typing, access to U-turn, and a great ability in Intimidate, making it a good offensive pivot.
  • Unlike other common Choice Scarf users, Landorus-T has the benefit of being immune to entry hazards like Toxic Spikes and Sticky Web from Glimmora and Ribombee, respectively. This allows Landorus-T to be an excellent anti-offense tool against hyper offense teams.
  • U-turn is useful to generate momentum and bring in teammates safely when foes are forced to switch out.
  • Due to the pressure Landorus-T applies on the opposing team such as when forcing out Zacian-C and Miraidon, it can also easily set up Stealth Rock.
  • Stone Edge hits Flying-types and Tera Flying foes like Rayquaza and Zacian-C, respectively, providing good coverage alongside Earthquake. Tera Ground boosts Earthquake's power, notably allowing a 2HKO on neutral Arceus formes.
  • Landorus-T fits well on bulky offense teams that require speed control and appreciate its ability to generate momentum. Wallbreakers such as Miraidon and Kyogre appreciate being brought in safely with U-turn.
  • Special attackers such as Giratina-O are problematic for Landorus-T; therefore, specially defensive Ting-Lu is a solid teammate to help deal with it. Ting-Lu also grants hazards support, which Landorus-T is able to utilize well to pressure neutral targets, while Landorus-T is faster than many unboosted threats, granting it the ability to pressure them offensively.
  • Kyogre is also an issue for Landorus-T, so pivots like Eternatus and Toxapex are good partners.
  • Since Landorus-T does not run bulk in this set, secondary walls such as Groudon and Toxapex can be used to check physical attackers.
  • Koraidon is also an excellent partner for Landorus-T, forming a good pivoting core with it to eliminate each other's checks in Giratina-O and Skeledirge, respectively.

Physical Wall.description:
• Toxapex is an excellent physically defensive wall capable of taking on foes such as Koraidon and Zacian-C.
  • Haze shuts down boosting attempts from the likes of Swords Dance Koraidon, Arceus, and Zacian-C.
  • Toxic prevents checks like Miraidon, Groudon, and Arceus-Ground from coming in freely and forcing Toxapex out while also putting setup sweepers on a timer.
  • If Toxapex runs Toxic Spikes, teammates such as Arceus-Ground can pressure Toxic Spikes absorbers like Eternatus and Clodsire. Poison Jab spreads poison to foes like Arceus-Fairy and Flutter Mane, and Ice Beam helps Toxapex greatly with Rayquaza while also helping against Landorus-T, Koraidon, and Gliscor.
  • Rocky Helmet is preferred to chip down physical attackers and most pivots. Mental Herb is an alternative that helps Toxapex deal with Taunt Arceus formes.
  • Tera Fairy makes Toxapex immune to Dragon-type moves, letting it deal with Scale Shot Koraidon, while Tera Ground helps Toxapex against Wild Charge Zacian-C.
  • Toxapex makes good partners with other defensive Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Clodsire, which can check threats like Miraidon. In return, Toxapex can help deal with threats like Koraidon and Zacian-C.
  • Offensive pivots like Miraidon, Koraidon, and Landorus-T also pair well with Toxapex, as they can bring it in more freely to handle their checks.
  • Gliscor can switch into Ground-types such as Ting-Lu, non-Ice Beam Arceus-Ground, and Heavy-Duty Boots Miraidon, spread entry hazards, and check Koraidon and Zacian-C, preventing Toxapex from being worn down.

Offensive.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Defensive.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Physically Defensive.description:
• Corviknight's high physical bulk gives it a strong defensive presence in the tier. It is one of the few consistent counters to strong Ground-types like Great Tusk, physical attackers like Chien-Pao, and some special attackers like non-Choice Specs Iron Bundle. Furthermore, its access to Defog also makes it a solid entry hazard remover, though it struggles against Gholdengo.
  • Body Press provides Corviknight with a way to leverage its high Defense stat, doing significant damage to Fighting-weak Pokemon.
  • Brave Bird allows Corviknight to threaten Flutter Mane and Great Tusk. Alternatively, Iron Head can be used to threaten the former while avoiding recoil damage.
  • Maximum HP investment and enough Defense to check Chien-Pao is combined with Leftovers and 96 Special Defense EVs, which allows Corviknight to take two Mystical Fires from most Flutter Mane, as well as giving it the ability to take on non-Choice Specs Iron Bundle and weaker attacks like Freeze-Dry from Choice Specs Iron Bundle.
  • Tera Steel or Flying can be used to shed the weaknesses of Corviknight's dual typing: Tera Steel allows Corviknight to resist Ice-type attacks from Chien-Pao, while Tera Flying allows Corviknight to resist Great Tusk's Fighting-type attacks. Depending on your choice, Terastallization also amplifies the power of either Iron Head or Brave Bird.
  • Corviknight works well as a part of a defensive core with Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Blissey, which can handle threats like Miraidon that obliterate Corviknight. Additionally, Corviknight makes a great partner for offensive threats like Chi-Yu, which appreciate a teammate that easily switches into Ting-Lu, or Great Tusk, which appreciates opposing Great Tusk being worn down.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Specially defensive Corviknight can switch into foes like Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, Gholdengo, and Glimmora.
  • U-turn is used to make Corviknight an effective defensive pivot that can maintain momentum against foes that force it out such as Miraidon and Koraidon.
  • Mirror Armor allows Corviknight to check Mystical Fire Flutter Mane, which would otherwise beat it. Alternatively, when paired with Pressure, Protect enables Corviknight to avoid being 2HKOed by Hydro Pump from Choice Specs Iron Bundle, as well as allowing Corviknight to deplete PP with Pressure more effectively.
  • Corviknight can use Tera Steel to get rid of its weakness to Electric and better take on Ice-type moves from Iron Bundle. Alternatively, it can opt to use Tera Ground to become immune to Miraidon's powerful Electro Drift.
  • Specially defensive Corviknight needs help dealing with strong physical wallbreakers such as Chien-Pao from teammates like Dondozo and Scream Tail. Furthermore, Pokemon that are especially threatened by Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, such as Koraidon, Great Tusk, and Skeledirge, are able to rely on specially defensive Corviknight as a consistent switch-in.

Bulky Calm Mind.description:
• Hatterene is mostly used to deny entry hazards on offensive teams to allow threats to come in unscathed, and stall teams so they have breaking power and an easier time against hazards.
  • The combination of Draining Kiss and Calm Mind with Defense investment helps Hatterene take hits from common walls like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu well, using them for recovery or setup.
  • Psyshock and Stored Power are interchangeable, as Psyshock is better on more balance and offensive teams due to its immediate power, while Stored Power fits better on bulkier teams, helping them break past walls the teams would otherwise struggle with like Dondozo.
  • Mystical Fire is useful coverage to hit Steel-types, such as Corviknight and Iron Treads, while Protect is used to scout double switches, scout Choice item uses, and rack up Leftovers recovery.
  • The Speed EVs are to outspeed Dondozo.
  • Tera Water provides Hatterene with a Fire resistance and Ghost neutrality to better deal with Koraidon and Flutter Mane. Additionally, Tera Water Hatterene resists Steel-type moves from Kingambit and Corviknight and resists Ice- and Water-type moves, allowing Hatterene to tank hits from Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle more effectively.
  • Tera Flying gives Hatterene immunity to Ground-type moves from Ting-Lu and Great Tusk while also resisting Fighting moves from Koraidon and Great Tusk. It also gives Hatterene a Spikes immunity, giving it easier entry against offensive teams.
  • Stealth Rock-weak Pokemon such as Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Iron Bundle are great partners to Hatterene, since they benefit from Hatterene denying Stealth Rock.
  • Koraidon and Miraidon are great partners, since Hatterene can break their most common checks, being Great Tusk and Toxapex for Koraidon, and Ting-Lu and Clodsire for Miraidon. Hatterene benefits from the breaking power of the Dragon-types, since they can remove offensive threats that annoy Hatterene like Flutter Mane and Miraidon.

Dual Screens.description:
• Grimmsnarl is a prominent part of Ubers hyper offense teams as the most reliable dual screens setter in the tier.
  • Taunt stops would-be setup sweepers, prevents entry hazards from Pokemon like Froslass and Glimmora, and stops Corviknight from using Defog.
  • Play Rough is mandatory to deal decent damage to one of the most common Pokemon in the tier in Ting-Lu, which is immune to Taunt and can use Grimmsnarl as setup bait for Spikes, damage it greatly with Ruination, and phaze any incoming Pokemon with Whirlwind. In a pinch, Play Rough also does good damage to Miraidon and Koraidon.
  • Tera Ghost is chosen to prevent Great Tusk and Iron Treads from using Rapid Spin, while Tera Steel provides useful resistances, most notably to Fairy-type attacks.
  • Grimmsnarl works well when paired with a suicide lead such as Froslass or Glimmora, as they can set up Spikes and Toxic Spikes, thereby giving any setup sweepers a much easier time sweeping.
  • Dual screens support gives Pokemon such as Calm Mind Miraidon, Swords Dance Koraidon, and Swords Dance Chien-Pao an easier time setting up and makes revenge killing them significantly harder.
  • Iron Moth is a notable teammate for being a strong setup sweeper that can also absorb Toxic Spikes.

Wallbreaker.description:
• Thanks to its great Attack, massive Speed, and fantastic defensive typing, Zacian-C functions as a great revenge killer and wallbreaker in Ubers.
  • Zacian-C's superb typing lets it survive many resisted hits from various attackers. This includes Ice-type attacks such as Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I and Ice Beam from specially offensive Arceus formes, as well as Fairy- and Dragon-type attacks from Arceus-Fairy, Miraidon, and Koraidon.
  • Swords Dance combined with Intrepid Sword skyrockets Zacian-C's Attack, allowing it to OHKO most Pokemon in the tier that don't resist its STAB attacks. Substitute is an option that should be used exclusively on hyper offense teams, allowing Zacian-C to generate momentum on a predicted switch into a check like Skeledirge.
  • While Intrepid Sword allows Zacian-C to threaten to KO many staples in the tier such as Arceus-Fairy, Kyogre, and Eternatus, Intrepid Sword only working once per battle means that one should think twice before sending Zacian-C onto the field, as wasting its ability makes for massive loss in damage output.
  • Tera Blast can be used in conjunction with Tera Ground or Tera Water as a way to 2HKO Skeledirge. Wild Charge can be used instead to deal with Toxapex, Corviknight, defensive Kyogre, and Arceus-Water. Tera Electric strengthens Wild Charge even more, allowing Zacian-C to break through Dondozo, while OHKOing Kyogre at +2. It also lets Zacian-C survive a Behemoth Blade from opposing Zacian-C at +3.
  • Crunch offers more flexibility, as it hits Skeledirge for super effective damage without relying on Terastallization. A Defense drop on the switch can also force it out. Tera Dark can be used in combination with Crunch, as it then 2HKOes Skeledirge.
  • Tera Fire allows Zacian-C to take on Skeledirge and Arceus-Fairy more comfortably, making it immune to Will-O-Wisp and giving it a resistance to Fire.
  • Tera Flying is another great tool to take Ground-types that would otherwise offensively check Zacian-C, like Groudon and Arceus-Ground, by surprise, transforming its weakness into an immunity and allowing Zacian-C to have a crucial free turn to beat its would-be checks.
