  • Tera Ground and Tera Water let Zacian-C 2HKO Skeledirge on the switch with Tera Blast and allow it to survive previously super effective moves like Groudon's Precipice Blades, Arceus-Ground's Judgment at +1, and Arceus's Earthquake at +2.
  • Zacian-C's excellent traits make it one of the best choices for bulky offense and hyper offense teams. Its blistering Speed lets it revenge kill many unboosted tier staples such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Arceus, and Eternatus. Its excellent Fairy typing also lets it check Choice Scarf Miraidon and Koraidon locked into a Dragon-type attack, and its high physical firepower makes it one of the best wallbreakers at forcing Calm Mind Arceus variants out.
  • Zacian-C has trouble breaking through physical walls like Groudon, Skeledirge, Corviknight, and Toxapex, which makes Miraidon a good teammate, as it threatens to OHKO them with its powerful STAB moves. Hazard setters like Ting-Lu and Groudon also make for good partners, as they help to put Zacian-C's targets into OHKO range. Ting-Lu can also check Miraidon sets, while Groudon is a good check to most Koraidon sets.
  • Kyogre makes for a good teammate, as it sets rain that reduces the damage Zacian-C takes from Fire-type attacks while also boosting Tera Blast Water, allowing Zacian-C to 2HKO Tera Fairy Skeledirge.
  • Choice Band Koraidon is a particularly strong partner for Zacian-C, as it can force Skeledirge to commit to using Tera Fairy due to Dragon Claw being able to 2HKO it otherwise, letting Zacian-C pressure it heavily with Behemoth Blade. In return, if Zacian-C forces Skeledirge to commit to using Tera Fairy, Choice Band Koraidon can then threaten to OHKO it with a Tera Fire- and Orichalcum Pulse-boosted Flare Blitz. Choice Scarf Outrage Koraidon can also accomplish this while providing speed control against opposing Zacian-C, Choice Scarf Kyogre, and Dragon Dance Arceus.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Specially defensive Eternatus functions as a good check to Kyogre and Calm Mind or Taunt Arceus formes thanks to Toxic, its high Speed and bulk, and reliable recovery.
  • Dynamax Cannon always does enough damage to break Kyogre's Substitute, allowing Eternatus to Toxic it on the next turn.
  • Flamethrower gives good neutral coverage with Dynamax Cannon, hits Zacian-C and Corviknight, and can fish for burns. Dragon Tail is an option to force out Arceus formes that Tera Poison or Steel to avoid Toxic, and it can annoy Clodsire. Toxic Spikes can be useful to pressure the opposing team, especially with smart double switches. In either case, the loss of Flamethrower leaves Eternatus more passive generally.
  • Sludge Bomb is much less reliable at setting poison than Toxic is; however, it allows Eternatus to have a chance against Calm Mind Tera Fairy Kyogre sets, which may otherwise use Substitute to block Toxic.
  • The given EV spread allows Eternatus to outspeed base 120 Speed Pokemon like Arceus and Palkia-O, with the rest of the EVs dumped into bulk.
  • Heavy-Duty Boots is optimal on teams lacking entry hazard removal, while Leftovers works better when Eternatus is paired with Giratina-O or Corviknight.
  • Tera Fairy is used, as its Dragon-type immunity is useful against Koraidon and Miraidon, and it provides a neutrality to Ice. Tera Water provides Eternatus with a resistance to Ice, making it much more reliable against Kyogre sets lacking Thunder, and a resistance to Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade.
  • Eternatus is very difficult to switch into generally, since it has strong neutral coverage and can poison most switch-ins. Its most reliable checks are Clodsire, Blissey, and Arceus-Poison, all of which don't care about being poisoned and can use Eternatus as a free setup opportunity. Exerting enough offensive pressure helps deal with these threats.
  • Eternatus works well as a third or fourth pokemon on defensive cores, since it absorbs Toxic Spikes and takes on the aforementioned Arceus formes and Kyogre. Ting-Lu makes for a fantastic partner as a result.
  • On teams lacking entry hazard removal, Skeledirge is a great partner, since both Pokemon can use Heavy-Duty Boots and have reliable recovery.
  • Switch-ins to Ground-types are much appreciated such as Corviknight, Giratina-O, and Landorus-T. Arceus-Ground makes for a good partner to pressure opposing Ground-types offensively.
  • While it can't switch in on Toxic, Mewtwo is a great annoyance, as it tends to be faster than Eternatus and can hit it with a super effective Psystrike. As such, pivots into Psystrike such as Corviknight or Ting-Lu are ideal teammates.

Agility Sweeper.description:
• Agility Eternatus leverages its fantastic bulk, speed, and offensive output to become one of the most threatening late-game sweepers.
  • 32 Speed EVs let Eternatus outspeed the entire metagame at +2, including +1 Koraidon. The rest of its EVs are invested in HP to help it survive hits while setting up. The given HP investment allows Eternatus to survive Choice Scarf Koraidon's Dragon Claw from full HP without Terastallizing, allowing it to bait in and remove Koraidon for the benefit of a teammate like Kyogre.
  • Flamethrower gives Eternatus consistent Fire-type coverage, but Fire Blast can somewhat alleviate Eternatus's power issues. In sun, Tera Fire-boosted Fire Blast is guaranteed to 3HKO Ting-Lu and is favored 2HKO Clodsire.
  • Tera Dragon allows Dynamax Cannon to 2HKO Toxapex and specially defensive Gliscor regardless of Eternatus's item while 2HKOing Clodsire and OHKOing Gliscor after Stealth Rock with Draco Plate or Life Orb.
  • Tera Fire strengthens Eternatus’ chosen Fire-type move, helping against Pokemon like Zacian-C and Kingambit. It is also a valuable defensive typing for Eternatus, notably giving it a resistance to Zacian-C's STAB moves, as well as a neutrality to Koraidon's Dragon Claw.
  • Leftovers is the preferred item to give Eternatus recovery that it would otherwise miss, especially outside of hyper offense teams, but Life Orb or Draco Plate can be used on hyper offense teams if a power boost is desired.
  • Agility Eternatus is a fantastic choice for offense teams that need a way to remove Toxic Spikes. It can come in on and force out many Pokemon like Skeledirge, Toxapex, Arceus-Fairy, and Choice Scarf Koraidon locked into Low Kick or Flare Blitz and set up on them. It also somewhat checks Kyogre at high HP, preserving HP on allied Koraidon.
  • Eternatus appreciates wallbreakers like Miraidon and Kyogre that can overwhelm its checks, like Clodsire, Ting-Lu, and Arceus-Ground.
  • Groudon, Ting-Lu, and Gliscor can set Spikes, making it easier to wear down Eternatus's checks.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Eternatus is one of the fastest Choice Scarf users in the tier. Its type combination and Fire-type coverage moves allow it to be a potent revenge killer. Unlike other common Choice Scarf users, Eternatus has the ability to absorb Toxic Spikes and Toxic many of its checks.
  • Dynamax Cannon is a strong and consistent STAB move used to revenge kill opposing Dragon-types and low HP neutral targets. Caution should be taken when using it, because while it is able to KO Koraidon from full health, it is not guaranteed to KO Miraidon and it doesn't even have a chance to do so against opposing Eternatus. That is why Draco Meteor can be used as a secondary option.
  • Sludge Bomb functions similarly to Dynamax Cannon, except that it can be used to hit Arceus-Fairy and Tera Fairy users super effectively.
  • Fire moves are used to hit Steel-types that resist both of Eternatus's STAB moves. Fire Blast can OHKO Zacian-C in sun, and it does much more damage than Flamethrower in general. However, Flamethrower's accuracy makes it more consistent.
  • Toxic can be used to put non-immune checks on a timer, such as Ting-Lu and many Arceus formes.
  • Modest is preferred to heavily increase Eternatus's odds to OHKO Zacian-C with a sun-boosted Flamethrower and guarantee an OHKO on Miraidon with Dynamax Cannon. Timid can be used for the greater consistency against Dragon Dance Arceus and ability to Speed tie other Choice Scarf Eternatus.
  • Tera Ghost is used for the Extreme Speed immunity and turning all of Eternatus's weaknesses into neutralities, which helps when facing off against Choice Scarf Koraidon or Miraidon.
  • Tera Fairy can be used to gain a Dragon-type immunity, which can preserve all of its health in the face of opposing Dragon-type attacks, probably thrown out by Choice Scarf Koraidon.
  • Tera Dragon provides a boost to Eternatus's Dragon-type moves. To use this boost as effectively as possible, Tera Dragon should be used with both Dynamax Cannon and Draco Meteor in Eternatus's moveset.
  • Tera Steel can provide a resistance to Zacian-C's STAB moves, Extreme Speed, and Dragon-type attacks; however, this leaves Eternatus extremely vulnerable to Choice Scarf Koraidon.
  • Terastallization with Eternatus should be avoided early-game, as Eternatus loses its ability to absorb Toxic Spikes.
  • Choice Scarf Eternatus can fit well on any type of team in need of a Toxic Spikes absorber and speed control in a single team slot, although it is generally a better fit on offensive teams.

Offensive Trick Room.description:
• Thanks to its great bulk, breathtaking offensive profile, and access to Trick Room, Calyrex-I is a ferocious wallbreaker for offensive teams.
  • Calyrex-I being an offensive Ice-type is great in Ubers, where there are very few Ice-resistant Pokemon and many targets hit super effectively by Ice, such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Ting-Lu, and Arceus-Ground.
  • An Adamant Nature allows Calyrex-I to outspeed Ting-Lu outside of Trick Room and threaten it without fear of taking a Ruination.
  • Heavy-Duty Boots is almost always the preferred item because of Calyrex-I's crippling weakness to entry hazards, but Calyrex-I can occasionally leverage its huge bulk to take advantage of Weakness Policy.
  • Tera Fire gives Calyrex-I an immunity to Will-O-Wisp from its best check, Skeledirge, while giving it a Fire and Steel resistance, allowing it to set up on even Koraidon and Zacian-C.
  • While Tera Fire is generally preferred for its better defensive capabilities, Tera Ground is an alright option that grants Calyrex-I STAB on High Horsepower, allowing it to OHKO Zacian-C without a boost.
  • Because of Calyrex-I's absurd wallbreaking prowess, it is best used on offensive teams as a mid-game wallbreaker or late-game sweeper once its checks are weakened. Because its bulk is so great, Calyrex-I can come in and set up on many Pokemon that can't damage it much, like Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, and defensive Eternatus.
  • Koraidon is an excellent partner, as it and Calyrex-I can weaken their shared checks like Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Kyogre for each other. Calyrex-I also loves Koraidon giving it free switches with a strong U-turn.
  • Kyogre can threaten Calyrex-I's checks for it, as can Calyrex-I for Kyogre. Kyogre is also decently slow, so it appreciates the support of Trick Room if Calyrex-I itself is KOed while Trick Room is active.

Defensive.description:
• Skeledirge functions as a catch-all check to the strongest physical attackers in Ubers, notably taking on Koraidon, Zacian-C, and some variants of E-Killer Arceus.
  • Unaware fully prevents Swords Dance Koraidon and Zacian-C from breaking down Skeledirge through pure force, in contrast to other physical walls like Groudon and Toxapex. Unaware even lets Skeledirge have some use against special attackers like Calm Mind + Will-O-Wisp Arceus-Fairy.
  • Torch Song is a good STAB move that boosts Skeledirge's Special Attack each time it's used, making it a good way to force out foes and turning Skeledirge into a potential late-game wincon.
  • There are two options for the secondary attacking move. Hex pairs very well with Will-O-Wisp, becoming a 130-Base Power STAB move. On the other hand, Earth Power is very useful against Pokemon that use Tera Fire to avoid burns, such as Koraidon, and it also hits Miraidon and Eternatus switch-ins hard.
  • The combination of reliable recovery with Slack Off and Heavy-Duty Boots means that Skeledirge can easily stay healthy throughout the game and not worry about entry hazards.
  • Tera Fairy is useful against Choice Band Koraidon in particular, as it can break through Skeledirge with Dragon Claw or Outrage; the downside is that Tera Fairy makes Skeledirge vulnerable to Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade. Tera Flying gives Skeledirge an immunity to Ground-type moves, which can be helpful against Arceus-Ground and Stomping Tantrum Koraidon. Tera Water provides a good all-around neutral defensive type to use which maintains an Ice-type resistance for Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I.
  • Skeledirge offers a great deal of role compression to teams thanks to its ability to reliably check so many offensive threats.
  • Skeledirge's main flaw is that it can be passive and vulnerable to double switches, U-turn, and Taunt.
  • Koraidon can often take advantage of the predictable switch to Skeledirge to bring in deadly offensive threats such as Chi-Yu, Walking Wake, and Kyogre with U-turn. As a result, it may be advantageous to anticipate U-turn in these scenarios.
  • Taunt is often employed as a method to bypass Skeledirge's Will-O-Wisp, especially by Koraidon and E-Killer Arceus. If you expect the foe to use Taunt, taking advantage of the situation and gaining Special Attack boosts with Torch Song is a great way to limit their ability to wallbreak.
  • Ting-Lu and Clodsire are excellent teammates for Skeledirge, as they cover most of the special attackers that come in on it, especially Miraidon, while Skeledirge can in turn handle most physical threats. Together they form a solid defensive backbone.
  • Skeledirge is unable to take on Ground-type physical attackers like Arceus-Ground, Tera Ground Zacian-C, and Groudon without using Tera itself. As a result, Pokemon that resist or are immune to Ground like Corviknight, Giratina-O, Landorus-T, and Arceus-Grass make for good partners. Corviknight has the additional benefit of solidifying the matchup against E-Killer Arceus.
  • Arceus-Fairy is useful as a backup check to Koraidon, and it makes it much more difficult for Koraidon to get easy momentum with U-turn.

Calm Mind.description:
• Espathra's niche is sweeping with its unique combination of Calm Mind, Speed Boost, and STAB Stored Power.
  • Dazzling Gleam super effectively hits Dark-types, which are immune to Stored Power, like Chien-Pao, Ting-Lu, and Grimmsnarl.
  • Substitute protects Espathra from potential status conditions that might stop its sweep, like from Clodsire's Toxic.
  • Protect, instead, allows Espathra to scout Choice-locked foes, such as Choice Specs Miraidon. In addition, Protect lets Espathra freely boost its Speed and get Leftovers recovery.
  • Roost keeps Espathra healthy and makes it less susceptible to priority attacks, like Chien-Pao and Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Roost also allows Espathra to beat Ting-Lu not packing Whirlwind one-on-one.
  • Tera Fairy turns Espathra's Dark weakness into a resistance, letting it survive the aforementioned Sucker Punch, as well as bolstering its Dazzling Gleam.
  • Tera Fighting also turns Espathra's Dark weakness into a resistance. Paired with Tera Blast, it beats the aforementioned Dark-types, Kingambit and Chien-Pao, and Steel-types like Iron Treads.
  • 112 EVs in Speed allow Espathra to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame at +1, including Iron Bundle. At +2, it can even outspeed +1 Iron Valiant.
  • The rest of its EVs are poured into physical bulk for survivability, since Calm Mind will boost Special Defense anyway. Electric Seed further improves Espathra's physical bulk while also giving it another boost to Stored Power. Leftovers gives Espathra long-term recovery, and it can be optimized with Calm Mind and the choice of Substitute, Protect, or Roost.
  • Espathra functions best on offensive teams to sweep after its checks have been weakened. Espathra is very frail and it usually can't switch in safely more than once, so it must fully commit to a sweep once it hits the field.
  • Fighting-types like Koraidon and Great Tusk make for good partners, as they threaten Dark- and Steel-types that resist or are immune to Espathra's Stored Power.
  • Strong Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu resist Dark- and Ghost-type attacks, which target Espathra, while also threatening Ghost- and Psychic-types. The former threaten Espathra, and the latter resist Stored Power.
  • Miraidon is a necessary partner if Espathra is holding Electric Seed, as Electric Terrain activates the item.

Choice Band.description:
• Wave Crash is a very strong STAB move. With Stealth Rock support and Tera Water's power boost, it crushes walls Palafin normally might struggle to break, like Toxapex and Corviknight, and always OHKOes Miraidon.
  • Close Combat is a strong, reliable coverage move that hits many of Palafin's checks like Corviknight and Koraidon for solid damage, while also hitting Water-types barring Toxapex for neutral damage.
  • Ice Punch allows Palafin to hit Dragon-types like the very common Koraidon and Miraidon while also hitting Water Absorb Clodsire. However, it cannot OHKO Koraidon and is not guaranteed to OHKO Miraidon.
  • Zen Headbutt allows Palafin to hit Toxapex super effectively, as well as potentially OHKOing Koraidon and having fantastic odds to 2HKO Miraidon.
  • Tera Water powers up Palafin's Water-type moves and allows Palafin to achieve feats like 2HKOing Miraidon with Jet Punch from full HP if rain is up.
  • Choice Band Palafin functions best on offensive teams to revenge kill threats like Flutter Mane or to break walls for its teammates mid-game. Remember, base Palafin needs to be used very early in a game to transform into its Hero Form.
  • Pelipper is a great partner for Palafin, as it checks Koraidon decently and replaces its sun with rain, strengthening Palafin's powerful Water-type attacks.
  • Koraidon sets up sun and resists Water-type attacks Palafin throws at it, so Palafin appreciates teammates that threaten Koraidon, like Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane. Also, Palafin is weakened by the sun Koraidon sets up, so it is best not to pair Palafin and Koraidon together.
  • Miraidon is a good partner, as it destroys Alomomola, a great counter to Palafin, and can safely bring Palafin onto the field with either U-turn or Volt Switch. Miraidon also appreciates Palafin threatening Ground-type Pokemon that can take Miraidon's Electric-type attacks, like Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, and Clodsire.

Bulk Up.description:
• Jet Punch's strong priority allows this Palafin set to still be threatening to offensive builds, while Drain Punch keeps Palafin healthy against bulkier teams.
  • Taunt allows Palafin to prevent common responses to setup sweepers from working, such as Whirlwind from Ting-Lu and Haze from Toxapex, while also preventing Pokemon like Annihilape from setting up alongside it.
  • Fairy is the Tera type of choice to allow Palafin to resist both of Koraidon's STAB attacks and potentially set up on Choice Scarf variants of it. Fairy also removes Palafin's weakness to Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry and Miraidon's Electric moves.
  • Palafin struggles to deal with Koraidon or Miraidon, which can come in on this set easily, especially given that Zero to Hero forces Palafin to switch at least once before it can be offensively threatening. As a result, this Palafin needs teammates that can defensively handle these threats. Ting-Lu and Iron Treads both help with Miraidon, and Pokemon like Great Tusk, Scream Tail, and Skeledirge can provide defensive solidity against Koraidon.
  • This Palafin set functions best with a sturdy defensive backbone alongside it, to mitigate the impact of Zero to Hero. As a result, it does not work as well on more hyper offensive playstyles.

Shed Tail.description:
• Orthworm faciliates setup sweepers on hyper offense teams thanks to its Ground immunity and access to Shed Tail. Unlike Cyclizar, Orthworm is able to pass slow Shed Tails due to its low Speed.
  • Orthworm has access to both Stealth Rock and Spikes, helping it wear down walls for its setup sweeper teammates. Stealth Rock is usually preferred for limiting Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Iron Bundle, but Spikes can be used if your team already has a Stealth Rock setter. Body Press punishes Kingambit and Chien-Pao trying to wear down and set up on Orthworm. Iron Head is a STAB move that lets Orthworm hit Flutter Mane trying to Taunt it.
  • Tera Water allows Orthworm to safely set up Shed Tail on Koraidon. Tera Ghost lets Orthworm completely blank Fighting-type attacks from Koraidon and Great Tusk while preventing Rapid Spin users from removing entry hazards set by both Orthworm and its teammates. However, Terastallizing Orthworm instead of one of its teammates is often not worth it.
  • Sitrus Berry provides Orthworm with the flexibility to take an attack and use Shed Tail, but Mental Herb is an option to block Taunt.
  • Grimmsnarl is a fantastic partner, as it provides screens support that improves Orthworm's longevity and further eases setup for teammates behind Shed Tail.
  • Entry hazard setters such as Glimmora and Froslass can wear down opponents in conjunction with Orthworm's hazards and Shed Tail, making it easier for teammates to break through walls.
  • Setup sweepers such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Kingambit, Iron Moth, and Espathra appreciate Orthworm's Shed Tail preventing status while giving them some leeway to boost. Koraidon in particular also appreciates Orthworm walling Great Tusk without Fighting-type moves and deterring Great Tusk from using Ground-type moves. Swords Dance Chien-Pao and Calm Mind Flutter Mane similarly appreciate Orthworm's Shed Tail easing setup by compensating for their lower bulk.

Suicide Lead.description:
• Glimmora stands out as one of the best suicide leads in the metagame thanks to its signature ability in Toxic Debris and great utility movepool consisting of Stealth Rock, Spikes, and Memento. Its high Special Attack alongside STAB and coverage options in Power Gem and Earth Power let it threaten most foes including Miraidon, Iron Bundle, and Iron Treads.
  • Tera Ghost Glimmora prevents common spinners like Iron Treads and Great Tusk from removing the entry hazards that Glimmora sets. Glimmora also benefits from Tera Ghost removing its 4x weakness to Ground-type attacks, letting it threaten these spinners with its coverage more reliably. However, given the nature of Glimmora as a dedicated lead, Terastallizing is not generally recommended.
  • Dazzling Gleam threatens Fighting-types like Koraidon and Great Tusk, as well as Miraidon. Its signature move, Mortal Spin, lets Glimmora act as an entry hazard remover and also cripples Stealth Rock setters like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk with poison.
  • Mortal Spin is a good option when facing setup sweepers that Glimmora cannot threaten if it doesn't have the right coverage like Swords Dance + Flame Charge Koraidon, Double Dance Miraidon, and Bulk Up Annihilape.
  • Memento allows a teammate to come in easily while also preventing entry hazard removal attempts.
  • Glimmora likes offensive staples like Miraidon and Koraidon that can take advantage of the entry hazards it sets up. They both threaten to OHKO Defog Corviknight.
  • Glimmora also appreciates Ghost-types such as Annihilape, Flutter Mane, and Gholdengo, while they appreciate the entry hazards that Glimmora sets.

Defensive.description:
• Dondozo is a solid physical wall due to its incredible physical bulk and Unaware. Dondozo fits well on bulky teams where it can switch into physical attackers such as Koraidon, Great Tusk, and Chien-Pao.
  • Liquidation hits Ground- and Fire-types such as Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Skeledirge. Earthquake lets Dondozo lure in and deal huge damage to Miraidon.
  • Curse makes Dondozo less passive and gives it sweeping potential. Protect lets Dondozo scout for Choice item users such as Koraidon, Miraidon, and Iron Bundle while also recovering health.
  • Rest is the only recovery option for Dondozo and can be used with Sleep Talk to deal with physical attackers such as Koraidon and Chien-Pao better. However, Miraidon's extensive presence in the metagame makes Rest unreliable.
  • Tera Steel lets Dondozo resist Moonblast from Flutter Mane and Freeze-Dry from Iron Bundle. Alternatively, Tera Fairy allows Dondozo to resist Fighting- and Dark-type moves from Koraidon and Chien-Pao while it also gains an immunity to Dragon-type moves.
  • Tera Ground gives Dondozo an immunity to Electric-type moves and can allow it to catch Miraidon by surprise and KO it using a boosted Earthquake.
  • Entry hazard removal options such as Corviknight, Iron Treads, and Great Tusk are great teammates, as foes can take advantage of Dondozo being worn down due to hazards. Dugtrio is a good teammate, as it can trap and KO Miraidon, making Dondozo incredibly tough to stop.
  • Dondozo appreciates special walls such as Ting-Lu, Corviknight, and Blissey that can switch into threats such as Miraidon and Flutter Mane. In return, Dondozo checks their threats in Koraidon, Chien-Pao and Great Tusk.

Bulk Up.description:
• Annihilape is a solid setup sweeper due to its good Attack stat, decent bulk, and unresisted STAB combination. It can take advantage of Pokemon such as Corviknight, Blissey, and Clodsire.
  • Bulk Up gives Annihilape the potential to sweep while also making it progressively harder to KO.
  • Taunt allows Annihilape to stay healthy and also stops bulkier Pokemon such as Corviknight, Clodsire, and Toxapex from recovering their health. Rest can alternatively be used with Chesto Berry to get rid of status and recover health, but it fails when Electric Terrain is up.
  • Drain Punch allows Annihilape to recover health and damage foes such as Ting-Lu and Iron Treads.
  • Rage Fist, along with Taunt, makes Annihilape incredibly threatening for slow walls such as Dondozo and Ting-Lu, as their attacks do little damage to Annilhilape while also boosting Rage Fist's power.
  • Tera Water allows Annihilape to take hits from special attackers such as Iron Bundle, Chi-Yu, and Flutter Mane while also letting it resist Flare Blitz from Koraidon.
  • Tera Fairy gives Annihilape an immunity against Dragon-type moves from Koraidon and Miraidon while also letting Annihilape take neutral damage from Ghost-type moves from Gholdengo and Flutter Mane, OHKOing them in return with boosted Rage Fist.
  • Annihilape reaches its full potential on dual screens hyper offense teams, where it can easily take hits while setting up.
  • Special walls such as Ting-Lu and Corviknight are good teammates on balance teams, as Pokemon such as Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Iron Bundle threaten Annihilape. Corviknight is also able to remove entry hazards for Annihilape. Kingambit as a teammate overwhelms Alomomola and Skeledirge, which are common checks to it and Annihilape.
  • Entry hazard setters such as Glimmora, Froslass, Toxapex, and Clodsire can lure in Corviknight, presenting Annhilape with a great setup opportunity by forcing Corviknight to either use Defog and activate Annihilape's Defiant or give Rage Fist a boost by attacking.

Defensive.description:
• Clodsire's special bulk combined with its Ground typing makes it one of the best answers to Miraidon, notably thanks to its ability to absorb Toxic Spikes, which would otherwise trouble other defensive Pokemon such as Ting-Lu.
  • Toxic prevents Clodsire from being overly passive and allows it to outlast Iron Bundle.
  • Clodsire is a decent setter of both Spikes and Stealth Rock, freeing up moveslots on teammates like Great Tusk. However, opposing spinners as well as Corviknight have very little issue removing entry hazards against Clodsire.
  • Water Absorb is the preferred ability, as it deters Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump and more comfortably tanks Draco Meteor from Miraidon, since Unaware would otherwise ignore the Draco Meteor special attack drop. It also checks Tera Water Miraidon, which is an important trait it possesses over Ting-Lu. Unaware checks non-Life Orb Calm Mind Miraidon while beating Calm Mind + Taunt Flutter Mane, as well as making Iron Moth's Fiery Dance boosts less of a threat.
  • Clodsire can use Tera Steel to take Miraidon's Draco Meteor far more easily while being able to take on Iron Bundle's STAB moves in conjunction with Water Absorb.
  • Both defensive and balanced teams enjoy Clodsire answering most Miraidon sets, helping fend off Flutter Mane, freeing up moveslots on other entry hazard setters, and pressuring opposing defensive Pokemon with Toxic.
  • Dondozo pairs with Clodsire nicely, as it appreciates Clodsire's ability to switch in on Miraidon's Electro Drift, while Dondozo can take on Chien-Pao and Great Tusk for it.

Setup Sweeper.description:
• Kingambit is a very threatening sweeper in Ubers thanks to Supreme Overlord, which grants it a guaranteed presence in the late-game. This is coupled with its access to Swords Dance, which not only enhances its already strong late-game but also gives it a tool to break holes in the opposing team during the early- and mid-game without needing teammates to faint. Kingambit's typing also allows it to be, at the very minimum, a one-time switch-in to very threatening Pokemon to the offensive teams it usually sees play in, like Flutter Mane.
  • Unfortunately, the prevalence of Tera Fairy in the metagame means that Sucker Punch will, most of the time, be resisted. This, coupled with the fast-paced nature of the metagame, makes Kingambit a relatively slow and ineffective revenge killer when unboosted. Koraidon and Zacian-C are top-tier threats that resist Kingambit's Dark-type STAB attacks and can OHKO or heavily dent it. Lastly, Intimidate Landorus-T helps opposing offensive teams pivot into Kingambit more easily, especially if Kingambit is not running Leftovers, as it will not passively heal the damage it takes from foes pivoting out
  • The listed EV spread allows Kingambit to outspeed Skeledirge while maximizing its offensive prowess. The HP EVs help Kingambit tank hits from Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Calm Mind Arceus a little better, giving it a favorable chance to avoid the 2HKO from Judgment and Earth Power from Arceus-Fairy.
  • Low Kick hits Koraidon hard while also allowing Kingambit to hit Pokemon like Tera Steel Giratina-O and Extreme Killer Arceus supereffectively. However, this leaves Kingambit hopelessly walled by Arceus-Fairy.
  • Tera Dark empowers Kingambit's Dark-type STAB attacks to absurd levels, giving it a chance to OHKO Koraidon with 5 fainted allies after a Swords Dance. Tera Dark also removes Kingambit's Ground-type weakness, allowing it to boost itself or hit Pokemon like Landorus-T more comfortably. Tera Flying is another option that makes Kingambit immune to Ground-type attacks, giving it the opportunity to freely set up or hit Pokemon like non-Whirlwind Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, Groudon, and Gliscor, while also giving it a resistance to Koraidon's Fighting-type attacks and a neutrality to its Flare Blitz. Tera Fire gives Kingambit a resistance to both of Zacian-C's STAB types and an immunity to burn from Pokemon like Groudon, Alomomola, and Skeledirge, the last of which can also leverage Tera Fairy to resist Kingambit's Kowtow Cleave.
  • Kingambit fits best on offensive teams, as they can weaken opposing Pokemon to the point where Kingambit sweeping is likely. Teammates like Koraidon, Zacian-C, Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Arceus can help Kingambit by weakening its checks and breaking holes. Kingambit can revenge kill and potentially sweep through the broken holes in return. Spikes from Pokemon like Groudon and Meowscarada can weaken Zacian-C and Koraidon for Kingambit. Lastly, Pokemon that can switch in on Landorus-T, like Calm Mind Arceus formes, are also good partners, as Kingambit doesn't appreciate taking Rocky Helmet damage.

Choice Item.description:
• Tera Ground can turn Headlong Rush into a devastating STAB attack that can break through bulky targets Great Tusk normally wouldn’t, such as Scream Tail and Dondozo.
  • Tera Fighting lets Great Tusk crush Corviknight with Close Combat, which severely hurts defensive structures reliant on it. This opens up powerful teammates like Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.
  • Earthquake makes Great Tusk harder to revenge kill than Headlong Rush does, as it doesn’t drop its defenses.
  • Rapid Spin works well for teams weak to entry hazards. It's a great way to support powerful threats weak to Stealth Rock, like Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Iron Bundle.
  • Knock Off provides fantastic item-removing support, and it especially cripples walls reliant on Leftovers like Scream Tail and Dondozo, allowing its team to more easily break past them.
  • Play Rough can be used to OHKO Koraidon without Terastallizing, as well as beating opposing Great Tusk. However, it has very little practical use outside of this.
  • Choice Scarf Great Tusk functions most effectively as a wallbreaker in the early- and mid-game, suited best for offensive structures that struggle with physical walls like the aforementioned Scream Tail and Dondozo. When building teams, remember Great Tusk must use Terastallization to actually break through said walls, so it may be hard for teammates to Terastallize.
  • Choice Band Great Tusk only functions well on Sticky Web teams, where the stronger and slower set appreciates Sticky Web dropping foes' Speed.
  • Koraidon is a great partner, setting up sun and activating Protosynthesis for Great Tusk. It further resists Water- and Grass-type moves aimed at Great Tusk, weakening the former. Koraidon also effectively baits in Skeledirge, which Great Tusk reliably threatens.
  • Miraidon is also a great partner, as it can threaten Flying-types, like Corviknight and the rarer Pelipper and Dragonite. This helps to make Great Tusk’s Headlong Rush much more spammable.
  • Gholdengo is also a good partner for Great Tusk, as it resists Ice-, Fairy-, and Grass-type moves aimed at Great Tusk, and it can threaten to KO Ice- and Fairy-types with super effective STAB Make It Rain. In addition, Gholdengo also blocks all hazard removal, helping to wear down walls for Great Tusk's team to eventually break through.

Offensive Utility.description:
• Great Tusk is the best offensive Stealth Rock or Rapid Spin user in the tier thanks to its solid typing and good physical bulk.
  • If Great Tusk is paired with Pokemon such as Corviknight, then Stealth Rock can be run instead of Rapid Spin. If paired with teammates that set Stealth Rock, then the best set would be Rapid Spin / Headlong Rush / Close Combat / Knock Off. Knock Off makes progress on Corviknight and covers the Air Balloon Gholdengo matchup.
  • Tera Ground lets Great Tusk deal incredible damage with Headlong Rush while also letting it survive Flutter Mane's Moonblast from full HP. Tera Steel flips the Fairy matchup and lets Great Tusk take on Ice- and Dragon-type attacks, but the additional weaknesses to Fighting and Ground make Great Tusk unable to take on Koraidon, Ting-Lu, and Iron Treads easily.
  • Great Tusk can be used to take on entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu and Iron Treads one-on-one by forcing them out and removing hazards. Jolly is usually preferred to outspeed Gholdengo, Modest Chi-Yu, and Glimmora, but Adamant lets Tera Ground Headlong Rush OHKO Koraidon and specially defensive Annihilape after one layer of Spikes or Stealth Rock.
  • Great Tusk should be used aggressively to force out and keep entry hazards off the field against other setters, such as Ting-Lu and Iron Treads, since Great Tusk is generally difficult to switch into. Great Tusk pairs well with Koraidon thanks to Orichalcum Pulse's sun, letting Great Tusk become an incredibly potent wallbreaker, and Great Tusk can clear entry hazards so that Koraidon can repeatedly come in. Miraidon also appreciates Great Tusk, as it forces out common checks such as Clodsire, Ting-Lu, and Iron Treads. Great Tusk also appreciates Blissey being able to take on all of the special attackers that force Great Tusk out, such as Flutter Mane, Miraidon, and Iron Bundle.

Setup Sweeper.description:
• Bulk Up allows Great Tusk to be a threatening sweeper. It can comfortably set up on common physical walls like Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, Corviknight, and defensive Great Tusk.
  • The STAB combination of Headlong Rush and Close Combat hits most physical walls for at least neutral damage. Earthquake may be used as the Ground-type STAB move to avoid defensive drops, but it is a weaker move, and it can't secure important OHKOs and 2HKOs at +1 Attack against some physical walls such as Toxapex, Scream Tail, and Alomomola.
  • A Jolly nature is used to outspeed all viable unboosted Pokemon after one Rapid Spin. An Adamant nature makes Great Tusk stronger while still letting it outspeed unboosted Iron Bundle at +1 Speed, but it misses out on outspeeding maximum Speed Gholdengo and tying Jolly Great Tusk.
  • Terastallizing into the Ground typing boosts Headlong Rush and guarantees some additional OHKOs and 2HKOs on foes like Toxapex and Scream Tail. Additionally, getting rid of the Fighting typing lets Great Tusk survive Fairy-type attacks such as Dazzling Gleam from Miraidon and Moonblast from Flutter Mane without Life Orb or Choice Specs, and it facilitates taking Dazzling Gleam and Play Rough from Scream Tail and Alomomola.
  • Alternatively, using Tera Steel gives Great Tusk resistances to Fairy-type attacks, Ice-type attacks from Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle, and Draco Meteor from Miraidon, allowing it to surprise them with a strong attack.
  • Koraidon is a solid partner because its sun activates Great Tusk's Protosynthesis, making its attacks even stronger. In return, Great Tusk can break through or strongly dent common Koraidon checks like Scream Tail, Alomomola, and Skeledirge, which allows Koraidon to clean more easily. Miraidon is also an excellent teammate, since Great Tusk can easily hard switch into its common checks and either threaten them with its attacks or set up on them.
  • Special attackers like Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Iron Bundle hugely threaten Great Tusk, so it is recommended to pair it with appropriate special walls like Blissey, Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, and Clodsire. Gothitelle is a less popular pick but it helps eliminate bulky checks like Dondozo and Pelipper, allowing Great Tusk to sweep more easily.

Defensive.description:
• Thanks to its solid physical bulk under sun and good defensive typing, Great Tusk acts as one of the best checks to Koraidon while also providing teams with entry hazard removal and a fantastic switch-in to other Ground-types in the tier such as Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Iron Treads.
  • Play Rough threatens a KO on Koraidon after entry hazard damage. Knock Off can be used to take on Air Balloon Gholdengo and wear down foes that want to switch into Great Tusk such as Corviknight and Annihilape, but it is generally outclassed by the sheer utility of Rapid Spin and Stealth Rock. The combination of Knock Off and Body Press can be used to pressure Corviknight switch-ins.
  • Bulk Up is an option to boost alongside opposing Great Tusk and Swords Dance Kingambit and Koraidon.
  • Great Tusk can Terastallize into the Fairy typing to take on physical attackers such as Koraidon, Chien-Pao, and Palafin in sun. However, be wary of Terastallizing against Koraidon that can still Terastallize themselves, as Choice Band Tera Fire Koraidon can take on Great Tusk one-on-one. Great Tusk can also Terastallize into the Ground typing or the Water typing, with both options removing its weakness to Fairy. The former also lets it fire off stronger Earthquakes as well, while the latter provides useful resistances to Fire moves from Koraidon as well as Ice- and Water-type moves, barring Freeze-Dry, from Iron Bundle.
  • Great Tusk fits on most teams as a bulky Stealth Rock setter and Koraidon check. Great Tusk can utilize Rocky Helmet to punish the use of U-turn, though this hurts its longevity, as it then loses Leftovers's passive recovery.
  • Great Tusk pairs well with defensive Scream Tail and Blissey, both of which can take on Iron Bundle while also providing Wish support for Great Tusk. Blissey can also take on Chi-Yu and Miraidon, while Scream Tail can take on Iron Valiant.
  • Great Tusk also pairs well with Gholdengo, as it appreciates Great Tusk forcing out Koraidon while preventing hazard removal in exchange. Choice Scarf Chi-Yu is a good partner due to its ability to pressure faster special attackers that trouble Great Tusk such as Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane. Great Tusk also pairs well with Miraidon, as non-Heavy-Duty Boots Miraidon appreciates it removing entry hazards and taking on Clodsire, Iron Treads, and Ting-Lu. Finally, Koraidon is a good partner, as it can set up sun, pivot into Great Tusk, and force out most hazard removal options besides opposing defensive Great Tusk.

Choice Specs.description:
• Flutter Mane is an impressive wallbreaker thanks to its nearly unrivaled Speed under sun and unresisted STAB moves and coverage. Mystical Fire notably hits Zacian-C, OHKOing it while sun is up, while also hitting Corviknight. Psyshock is Flutter Mane's strongest attack versus Clodsire, boosted Calm Mind Arceus formes, and Eternatus. Memento is an alternative to facilitate setup from a sweeping teammate such as Swords Dance Koraidon.
  • Tera Fairy strengthens Flutter Mane's Moonblast to devastating levels, letting it 2HKO Arceus formes, bulky Calm Mind Kyogre, and defensive Eternatus while also OHKOing defensive Landorus-T and defensive Groudon with a layer of Spikes. Tera Fairy also notably prevents Flutter Mane from being OHKOed by Kingambit's unboosted Sucker Punch.
  • Flutter Mane fits well on teams that appreciate its ability to wallbreak for Calm Mind Arceus and Miraidon. Thanks to Protosynthesis, when sun is up, Flutter Mane outspeeds the entire unboosted metagame, letting it act as a very strong revenge killer as well. Flutter Mane also has the important niche of being one of three viable Fairy-types, which is key in letting it switch into the myriad of strong Dragon-type moves in the tier.
  • Flutter Mane pairs best with Koraidon, as Koraidon sets up sun to boost Flutter Mane's Speed and also uses U-turn to pivot it into Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Groudon, and Landorus-T. Both Flutter Mane and Koraidon also wear down Arceus-Fairy and Toxapex for each other, making them a very potent core. Flutter Mane also pairs well with Kyogre, as they both pressure a similar subset of checks in Eternatus, Koraidon, Clodsire, and Toxapex. Kyogre can also switch into Choice Scarf Koraidon's Flare Blitz if Flutter Mane doesn't want to risk a Speed tie. Since Flutter Mane is such a potent wallbreaker, it appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Groudon. Groudon in particular is a very potent partner for checking the physical attackers that can take advantage of Flutter Mane while also setting sun for it. Miraidon and Eternatus are other good partners for appreciating Flutter Mane potentially breaking through Ting-Lu and Clodsire.
  • Flutter Mane primarily has issues entering the field versus physical attackers such as Zacian-C, Arceus formes, and Kingambit. As a result, Pokemon such as Groudon, Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Landorus-T pair well with it by checking the aforementioned Pokemon. Kyogre, Clodsire, and Arceus formes can also check Flutter Mane prior to it Terastallizing, so checks to them such as Eternatus, Arceus-Ground, and Koraidon are appreciated.

Life Orb.description:
• Life Orb allows Flutter Mane to become an impressive wallbreaker and sweeper thanks to its strong neutral coverage and extremely fast Speed backed by Protosynthesis.
  • Calm Mind can ease prediction on switches without having Life Orb recoil, and it gives Flutter Mane the strength to clean up teams much more easily.
  • Taunt allows Flutter Mane to take advantage of its huge Speed stat to become an effective anti-lead against Pokemon such as Ribombee and Meowscarada, which are too fast for Taunt Arceus to handle. It can also be useful in a pinch to prevent dangerous setup sweepers such as Calm Mind Arceus formes from boosting.
  • Substitute can take advantage of predicted switches, and it gives Flutter Mane a useful option against Sucker Punch Kingambit, although the HP loss can quickly add up with Life Orb recoil. Its most notable use is to scout for enemy Tera types.
  • Mystical Fire nails Steel-types like Zacian-C and Corviknight, which otherwise wall Flutter Mane. Mystical Fire notably has a chance to OHKO Zacian-C at +1 in the sun.
  • Psyshock obliterates Clodsire, which otherwise walls this set. Additionally, it comes in handy against Calm Mind Arceus formes that may Terastallize into the Poison typing to resist a predicted Moonblast.
  • Tera Fairy powers up Flutter Mane's strongest attack in Moonblast, letting it OHKO Ting-Lu after a Calm Mind.
  • Koraidon is a near necessity as a teammate, setting the sun to activate Protosynthesis. Choice Scarf Koraidon in particular is a great teammate, as it can bring Flutter Mane in easily on common switch-ins such as Skeledirge and Landorus-T. Koraidon also helps break down shared checks such as Arceus formes and Kyogre.
  • Additional special attackers such as Miraidon and Kyogre can assist in overwhelming common specially bulky Pokemon such as Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Arceus formes, making them good teammates.
  • Despite its pathetic Defense stat and Life Orb recoil, Flutter Mane offers legitimate defensive utility for teams thanks to its myriad of immunities as well as its decent Special Defense. It features as a prominent Dragon-type switch-in on teams that forgo Zacian-C or Arceus-Fairy, which is especially helpful for Miraidon. Its Normal- and Fighting-type immunities come in handy for both Koraidon and Extreme Killer Arceus. It should be noted, however, that switching into these is very high-risk, high-reward, as while Flutter Mane can take great advantage of its immunities, a wrong prediction will result in an easy OHKO for the opponent.
  • Flutter Mane's extremely threatening nature and low defenses mean that it often forces a reactionary Tera from the opponent, often Tera Fire from Koraidon or Zacian-C or Tera Poison from Arceus formes. Care should be taken to not risk Flutter Mane in such situations when it isn't needed.

Specially Defensive.description:
• A decent defensive typing allows Iron Treads to act as a check to Miraidon and Flutter Mane, and use the opportunity to remove or set entry hazards.
  • Knock Off cripples common switch-ins such as Ting-Lu and Corviknight, while Volt Switch keeps momentum for your team.
  • 16 IVs in Defense mean that Iron Treads will receive a Special Defense boost in Electric Terrain, helping with switching into Miraidon.
  • Iron Treads can use Tera Fairy to remove its weaknesses to Fighting and Fire, which can be helpful versus Koraidon and Chien-Pao, and with taking coverage from Miraidon and Flutter Mane. However, it loses its immunity to Electric and resistance to Fairy. Iron Treads can alternatively use Tera Ground for an extra boost to Earthquake, but it suffers from similar demerits as Tera Fairy.
  • Since both Miraidon and Flutter Mane have Fire-type coverage options, Iron Treads appreciates being paired with Pokemon such as Ting-Lu that can handle those attacks. Choice Scarf Koraidon and Booster Energy Flutter Mane are also good teammates, as they can revenge kill Miraidon and Flutter Mane while benefitting from Iron Treads removing entry hazards.
  • Skeledirge's ability to check Koraidon and Iron Valiant also makes it a great partner for Iron Treads. Teammates that can switch into Great Tusk such as Dondozo and Alomomola also pair well, with Alomomola even providing Wish support to increase Iron Treads's longevity.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest allows Iron Treads to utilize an offensive spread while still letting it be a fairly safe option against Miraidon and Flutter Mane.
  • Iron Head allows Iron Treads to beat Tera Fairy Miraidon.
  • Knock Off can remove crucial items from foes like Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, and Corviknight.
  • Volt Switch is useful for grabbing momentum on non-Ground-type foes that switch in on Iron Treads like Corviknight, Koraidon, Dondozo, and Pelipper.
  • A Jolly nature gives Iron Treads a Speed boost from Quark Drive, which is often crucial to be able to beat Choice Specs Miraidon one-on-one, and lets it pick off foes that would normally outspeed it without Electric Terrain.
  • Ground is the preferred Tera type to boost the power of Earthquake while weakening incoming Fire- and Fighting-type attacks; alternatively, other Tera types can provide defensive utility but not any offensive boost.
  • This set works best on offensive teams where it is paired up with teammates that are weak to Fairy-type moves, such as Miraidon, Koraidon, Great Tusk, and Chien-Pao. Iron Treads allows these Pokémon to be played more freely because it can reliably deal with Flutter Mane and opposing Miraidon while applying offensive pressure itself.
  • Flutter Mane is another great teammate because Iron Treads lures Corviknight and weakens it with Knock Off or Volt Switch, this gives Flutter Mane an easier time to break through enemy teams.

Heavy-Duty Boots.description:
• Freeze-Dry and Hydro Pump make Iron Bundle incredibly threatening with perfect coverage.
  • Taunt can be used to stop recovery and status attempts from walls like Corviknight, while Flip Turn can gain momentum. Encore is effective at PP stalling recovery attempts from Pokemon while also locking Pokemon into suboptimal moves like Stealth Rock to take advantage of.
  • Tera Ice boosts Freeze-Dry's and Ice Beam's power to high levels and also removes the neutrality to Freeze-Dry from opposing Iron Bundle, making a potential mirror match safer.
  • Tera Water Iron Bundle has immense power on Hydro Pump; Tera Water also removes its Fighting-type weakness and Fire-type neutrality, which helps against Choice Scarf Great Tusk and Koraidon trying to revenge kill it.
  • Iron Bundle has to use its high Speed to force out frail Pokemon or force defensive Terastallization, both of which it can take advantage of.
  • Getting Iron Bundle safe switch-ins on defensive Pokemon that are threatened by Hydro Pump is the best way to use its offensive capabilities, allowing for defensive answers to be Taunted or pivoted on to wear down opposing teams.
  • Pelipper and Miraidon are strong teammates for Iron Bundle, providing rain and Electric Terrain support to power it up.
  • Entry hazard setters are also very strong, since Iron Bundle appreciates checks like Corviknight and Annihilape being worn down. It also can use Taunt to stop Defog Corviknight and pressure the premier spinners in Great Tusk and Iron Treads.

Choice Specs.description:
• The combination of Hydro Pump and Freeze-Dry gives Iron Bundle an unresisted STAB combination, making it extremely threatening with Choice Specs.
  • Flip Turn allows Iron Bundle to pivot in order to gain momentum, while Ice Beam OHKOes Koraidon and uninvested Miraidon.
  • Tera Ice allows Iron Bundle to further boost its Ice-type moves and resist Freeze-Dry from opposing Iron Bundle and Ditto. Tera Water is a good option on teams with rain support in order to let it 2HKO Heavy-Duty Boots Blissey in rain after slight chip.
  • Choice Specs allows Iron Bundle to 2HKO walls such as Ting-Lu, Corviknight, and Scream Tail with Hydro Pump as well as Toxapex with Freeze-Dry.
  • Miraidon is a great teammate, as it can lure in Pokemon weak to Hydro Pump such as Ting-Lu and Iron Treads and pivot into Iron Bundle using U-turn. It also sets Electric Terrain, giving Iron Bundle a Speed boost upon entry.
  • Entry hazard removal options such as Corviknight, Iron Treads, and defensive Great Tusk are great teammates, as Iron Bundle can get worn down pretty quickly from repeatedly switching into Stealth Rock.

Dragon Dance.description:
• Baxcalibur functions as a niche wallbreaker and occasional sweeper for hyper offense teams. Glaive Rush and Icicle Spear are fantastic STAB moves that hit most of the tier for super effective or neutral damage.
  • Earthquake provides good coverage against common defensive Pokemon such as Toxapex and Skeledirge.
  • Baxcalibur competes heavily with Chien-Pao as an offensive Ice-type, as they fill a similar role on teams. The key difference is Baxcalibur's ability to boost its Speed. Another key difference is Baxcalibur's Dragon typing, which gives it weaknesses to common Dragon- and Fairy-type moves. This stacks weaknesses with Koraidon and Miraidon.
  • Tera Fairy provides Baxcalibur with a Dragon immunity to better deal with Koraidon and Miraidon, as well as a resistance to Fighting-type moves from Pokemon such as Koraidon and Great Tusk. It also ensures Kingambit and Chien-Pao cannot easily revenge kill Baxcalibur with Sucker Punch.
  • Tera Steel grants Baxcalibur important resistances to types like Dragon and Fairy, as well as a Toxic immunity, giving it setup potential against certain walls like Toxapex.
  • Grimmsnarl is a great partner: it provides dual screens support, easing Baxcalibur's setup and entry into the match. Another good partner is Hatterene or another form of hazard control, since denying Stealth Rock assists Baxcalibur in setting up.
  • Miraidon is a recommended teammate, as it can provide both sweeping potential and wallbreaking power and appreciates Baxcalibur breaking down Clodsire and Ting-Lu. Another recommended teammate is Koraidon, since it appreciates Baxcalibur removing walls like Toxapex and Skeledirge.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Gholdengo outspeeds the entire unboosted metagame, can use Trick to weaken defensive teams, and also blocks Defog and Rapid Spin to keep pressure on defensive Pokemon with entry hazards.
  • Focus Blast deals more damage to Ting-Lu, Chi-Yu, and Iron Treads, while Nasty Plot and Recover can be used after Gholdengo's Choice Scarf has been removed via Trick to turn it into a setup sweeper or give it longevity, respectively.
  • Tera Fighting powers up Focus Blast, which allows Gholdengo to potentially 2HKO Ting-Lu. Alternatively, Gholdengo can use Tera Steel on sets not using Focus Blast to boost Make It Rain and remove its weaknesses to Flutter Mane's and Chien-Pao's STAB moves.
  • Gholdengo should almost always be switched in if Corviknight is on the field and be used sparingly against Great Tusk and Iron Treads if a Rapid Spin is predicted, but this is risky due to its Earthquake weakness.
  • Spikes setters like Ting-Lu and Clodsire on balance teams as well as Froslass on hyper offense teams appreciate Gholdengo keeping up Spikes and it acting as a revenge killer for their respective archetypes.
  • Pokemon like Calm Mind Miraidon, Calm Mind Flutter Mane, and Swords Dance Chien-Pao also benefit from Gholdengo using Trick on defensive Pokemon, forcing them to either heal or be locked into an unfavorable attack while they set up. Gholdengo can also clean up weakened teams if these Pokemon are used to wallbreak first.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Nasty Plot + Recover Gholdengo is the best option for preventing entry hazard removal in the tier.
  • Tera Steel bolsters Make It Rain's power, allowing Gholdengo to overwhelm threats such as Koraidon, defensive Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, and bulky Tera Fairy Miraidon after a Nasty Plot boost while removing its Ghost typing.
  • Tera Normal blocks incoming Ghost-type attacks from the likes of Flutter Mane, Choice Scarf Houndstone, and opposing Gholdengo.
  • Air Balloon provides a temporary measure against Ground-type attacks from Pokemon such as Great Tusk and Iron Treads, allowing Gholdengo to sometimes switch into them.
  • Gholdengo best fits on hyper offense and balance teams that aim to preserve their own entry hazards for as long as possible.
  • Frail leads such as Froslass and Masquerain appreciate their entry hazards staying intact against Great Tusk, Iron Treads, Corviknight, and Glimmora.
  • Glimmora and Ting-Lu make for good teammates on balance teams in particular, as they provide similar entry hazard support while having sufficient power and bulk to punish threats.
  • Wallbreakers such as Miraidon, Koraidon, and Chi-Yu appreciate multiple entry hazards to further overwhelm the opposition with their tremendous attacks and power.

All-out Attacker.description:
• Ice Spinner is an alternative to Icicle Crash because of its better accuracy, but it is slightly weaker, cannot flinch, and is a contact move.
  • Ice Shard hits Miraidon and Koraidon for super effective damage, 2HKOing the former, and 2HKOes Flutter Mane reliably. Sucker Punch may be considered over Ice Shard, as it does more damage to Iron Bundle and can KO Flutter Mane, but it misses out on revenge killing Koraidon and is often prediction-reliant.
  • Sacred Sword allows Chien-Pao to OHKO Chi-Yu, Kingambit, and opposing Chien-Pao, which otherwise resist its STAB moves.
  • Chien-Pao can use Tera Dark to make Crunch stronger and 2HKO Corviknight and Toxapex if it gets lucky with a Defense drop. Chien-Pao can also use Tera Ice in order to 2HKO Corviknight more reliably and boost Ice Shard damage—notably against Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Koraidon. Lastly, Tera Electric Chien-Pao with Tera Blast can easily break through bulky checks like Toxapex, Corviknight, and Dondozo.
  • Chien-Pao fits best with other strong wallbreakers that benefit from the removal of defensive walls. These include Koraidon, Miraidon, Iron Bundle, and offensive Great Tusk.
  • Defensive partners like Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, and Skeledirge are mandatory to handle fast and strong threats like Koraidon and Miraidon, as Chien-Pao cannot OHKO them if they are at full health. Additionally, Great Tusk and Ting-Lu can set up entry hazards, which is crucial for getting chip on defensive walls.

Choice Band.description:
• Icicle Crash 2HKOes Corviknight and avoids Rocky Helmet, while Ice Spinner is more accurate and has the bonus of removing Electric Terrain.
  • Sacred Sword hits checks such as Kingambit and opposing Chien-Pao. Another option is to run a double priority combination with Ice Shard and Sucker Punch. Sucker Punch hits very crucial Pokemon that Ice Shard can't, such as Tera Fire Koraidon, Tera Fire Flutter Mane, and Iron Bundle.
  • An Adamant nature allows Chien-Pao to achieve ridiculous feats such as revenge killing Flutter Mane from 90% HP with Ice Shard. A Jolly nature lets Chien-Pao Speed tie with Koraidon, Miraidon, opposing Jolly Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane, giving Chien-Pao the freedom to click its strongest moves less reluctantly.
  • Tera Dark allows Chien-Pao to 2HKO the entire tier while letting it still switch into weaker moves such as Shadow Ball. Tera Ice gives Chien-Pao the ability to OHKO Flutter Mane with Ice Shard, making it a terrific late-game cleaner.
  • Choice Band Chien-Pao is a wallbreaker that is best suited for bulky offense structures that love its revenge killing and wallbreaking capabilities.
  • Pokemon like Iron Treads, Hatterene, and Koraidon, which can provide entry hazard control or pivoting, are excellent teammates for Chien-Pao.

Swords Dance.description:
• Swords Dance makes Chien-Pao immensely threatening, letting it break through bulky foes such as Toxapex, Great Tusk, and Corviknight.
  • Ice Spinner is a more reliable option thanks to its perfect accuracy, but Icicle Crash's power and flinch chance greatly help out against all foes that can take a hit from Chien-Pao, such as Corviknight and Great Tusk.
  • Ice Shard is a reliable priority attack mainly used to better deal with Miraidon and Koraidon.
  • Sucker Punch can be used as a stronger but prediction-reliant alternative that OHKOes Flutter Mane without a boost and OHKOes the likes of Iron Bundle and Miraidon after a boost. It also provides a favorable roll to OHKO Koraidon if it has Terastallized into the Fire typing.
  • Tera Dark boosts Crunch, allowing Chien-Pao to more reliably beat physically defensive Corviknight and Toxapex. Tera Dark Chien-Pao holding Life Orb can OHKO both Pokemon after a Swords Dance boost.
  • Tera Ice can be used instead to boost Chien Pao's Ice-type attacks. This also makes Ice Shard a better revenge killing option.
  • Sacred Sword can be used to hit foes that resist Chien-Pao's STAB moves, like Kingambit and opposing Chien-Pao.
  • Life Orb is the primary item choice because it gives Chien-Pao a lot of power while allowing it to run a Jolly nature and not lose out on potential OHKOs.
  • Heavy-Duty Boots sacrifices a lot of power but gives Chien-Pao the ability to ignore entry hazards, allowing it to come in and potentially set up multiple times throughout a game.
  • Black Glasses in conjunction with an Adamant nature can be used as an alternative to Life Orb to not have recoil while still being able to OHKO the likes of Corviknight and Toxapex after obtaining a Swords Dance boost and using Tera Dark.
  • This set can be used as both an early-game wallbreaker and a late-game sweeper thanks to Chien-Pao's strong STAB attacks and priority moves.
  • Chien-Pao has very little defensive utility, so having a defensive core for it to fall back on is recommended for balance teams. On offensive teams, it can afford to run Focus Sash to take at least one hit from foes that would usually threaten it out.
  • Great Tusk is Chien-Pao's best teammate, as Great Tusk can handle one of Chien-Pao's hardest checks in Koraidon and provide Rapid Spin support. Rapid Spin also helps keep Focus Sash intact.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Ting-Lu is the premier Miraidon check in the tier, being able to avoid the 2HKO from it without needing to Terastallize.
  • It can reliably generate chip damage using Ruination when it forces special attackers out, and it can even force Arceus to use up Recover PP. On these forced switches, it can also set up Spikes or Stealth Rock, which further chips down switch-ins for the rest of the game due to the limited distribution of entry hazard removal in the tier.
  • Whirlwind prevents opposing setup threats such as Double Dance Miraidon and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground from snowballing out of control, as well as using its own Spikes for chip damage. Protect can also be used in this moveslot, which allows for more Leftovers recovery and scouting of Choice item users and Tera types. The preference will come down to how much the team relies on Ting-Lu to phaze setup threats such as Calm Mind Arceus and Miraidon.
  • Leftovers is mandatory on Ting-Lu since it does not have any form of reliable recovery.
  • Ting-Lu will very rarely need to use its Tera types, as its natural typing provides a strong Electric immunity for Miraidon. Tera Steel provides a Dragon resistance versus Miraidon while also letting Ting-Lu handle Dazzling Gleam from Calm Mind + Tera Fairy Miraidon, and it also grants an immunity to Toxic from Eternatus and Toxapex. Tera Fairy provides a Dragon immunity against Miraidon, allowing Ting-Lu to better answer Tera Dragon sets with Calm Mind or Choice Specs, and Ting-Lu becomes resistant or immune to Koraidon's STAB moves. However, this comes at the expense of not resisting Fairy versus Tera Fairy Miraidon. Poison resists Close Combat and Zacian-C's Play Rough, and it allows Ting-Lu to absorb Toxic Spikes. Tera Water allows it to take Kyogre's STAB moves while also resisting Koraidon's Flare Blitz. It also lets Ting-Lu check the rare, but otherwise hard to check, Chi-Yu and Walking Wake. While all of these are good options for Ting-Lu, it benefits much more from its natural typing and should only Terastallize as a last resort.
  • Ting-Lu can also switch in safely against most defensive Pokemon in the tier, such as support Arceus formes, Groudon, Skeledirge, Giratina-O, and Toxapex, and then use this opportunity to set up a hazard or generate chip damage with Ruination.
  • It struggles against physical threats such as Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus, so it is best paired with Pokemon such as defensive Arceus-Fairy, Skeledirge, Groudon, and Toxapex that can switch into them reliably. Ting-Lu can also enable teammates such as Choice Scarf Koraidon, Miraidon, and Kyogre to clean more easily with the chip damage it generates from Ruination.
  • Due to Ting-Lu being unable to reliably check Choice Specs Miraidon long-term, it’s best to have some form of speed control alongside it, whether it be Choice Scarf Koraidon or Zacian-C.
  • Ting-Lu can function as a team's sole special wall, but it does appreciate naturally bulky Pokemon such as Kyogre and Groudon to handle some hits, which lets Ting-Lu remain a reliable Miraidon check. It can also pair well alongside the tier's Defoggers, Giratina-O and Corviknight as it is prone to Spikes chip damage and appreciates avoiding that to better check Miraidon. In a similar vein, Eternatus and Toxapex are good Toxic Spikes absorbers, the former of which can also soft check Kyogre and special Arceus formes.

Feesh (Offensive Wallbreaker).description:
• Overheat hits extremely hard and can 2HKO even the bulkiest of Pokemon. Fire Blast and Flamethrower can be used to KO foes without Chi-Yu suffering a Special Attack drop, with Flamethrower having perfect accuracy.
  • The only reason to run Timid over Modest is to outspeed Jolly Great Tusk, Jolly Annihilape, and fast Iron Treads with Special Defense investment.
  • Tera Fire allows Chi-Yu to turn 2HKOs to OHKOs, for example OHKOing opposing Chi-Yu with Overheat. Tera Fire also lets it 2HKO any prominent special wall, including Toxapex, Blissey, and Ting-Lu, OHKOing them with sun.
  • Choice Specs Chi-Yu is a wallbreaker, suited best for offensive teams. Koraidon is an excellent teammate because it sets sun and pivots Chi-Yu in with U-turn. Koraidon and Chi-Yu also threaten each other's checks, like Koraidon threatening Blissey and Garganacl and Chi-Yu threatening Skeledirge and Dondozo.
  • Helpful teammates are those that can get Chi-Yu in safely and force out its few checks. Corviknight and Koraidon are noteworthy examples, pivoting into special walls such as Ting-Lu. Lures such as Heavy Slam Koraidon and Great Tusk, which beat Dachsbun, and Psyshock Flutter Mane, which beats Toxapex and Blissey, are also appreciated teammates.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Fire Blast is Chi-Yu's strongest STAB move without any stat drops. Psychic is an alternative that 2HKOes common switch-ins such as Dachsbun and Toxapex. Overheat facilitates revenge killing, hitting even Pokemon that resist it such as Koraidon hard, and is a better midground play.
  • Memento serves as a way to facilitate sweepers like Swords Dance + Flame Charge Koraidon that Chi-Yu is usually paired with.
  • Tera Fire powers up Flamethrower and Overheat to nuclear levels, turning 2HKOs against Pokemon such as Koraidon into OHKOs. Tera Dark nullifies Chi-Yu's Stealth Rock weakness while making Dark Pulse 2HKO Dachsbun and Toxapex. Tera Grass should only be used with Tera Blast; it gives Chi-Yu nice resistances to Ground and Water and allows Chi-Yu to OHKO Great Tusk and 2HKO Ting-Lu after Spikes damage.
  • Choice Scarf Chi-Yu is a revenge killer best suited for offensive teams.
  • Pokemon that can get Chi-Yu safely into the field, such as Koraidon, Miraidon, and Corviknight, are excellent teammates for it. Koraidon also sets up sun, further boosting Chi-Yu's Fire-type attacks.
  • Ting-Lu and Glimmora can set entry hazards to guarantee some 2HKOs, such as against opposing Ting-Lu.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Nasty Plot Chi-Yu can threaten to KO foes it couldn't otherwise, such as Ting-Lu and Blissey. Overheat hits extremely hard and threatens to OHKO Ting-Lu at +2. Flamethrower is valuable for its perfect accuracy.
  • A Modest nature alongside Life Orb lets Chi-Yu OHKO Ting-Lu at +2. Heavy-Duty Boots can be used instead to give Chi-Yu more opportunities to switch in, but the loss of power is notable.
  • Chi-Yu fits best on offensive teams with Pokemon such as Cyclizar and Grimmsnarl that can facilitate its setup. Sticky Web support from Masquerain is also useful, as it lets Chi-Yu outrun Pokemon like Koraidon and Miraidon and KO them at +2.
  • Chi-Yu's best partner is Koraidon, since it sets up sun, can safely bring Chi-Yu into play with U-turn, and threatens Blissey. Other good partners are special attackers that benefit from special walls being neutered by Chi-Yu, such as Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Gholdengo. Great Tusk is also greatly appreciated, as it can remove Stealth Rock and threatens Blissey and Ting-Lu for Chi-Yu. Chi-Yu can deal with Corviknight and Dondozo in return.

Dragon Dance.description:
• With Dragon Dance and Acrobatics, Roaring Moon is a strong sweeper on offensive teams, with coverage to beat almost all Pokemon.
  • Tera Flying allows Roaring Moon to set up on Great Tusk and Body Press Corviknight and boosts Acrobatics's power to achieve feats such as OHKOing Toxapex and Ting-Lu after two Dragon Dances and entry hazard or slight chip damage.
  • Crunch is more reliable, having a chance to drop Defense with no potential drawback, while Jaw Lock has the potential to give Roaring Moon a free chance to set up when paired with Roost, assuming a favorable target is trapped. If an unfavorable target is trapped, however, it has a major downside, making it less consistent.
  • Roost gives Roaring Moon more opportunities to use Dragon Dance, turning weaker Pokemon like Brave Bird Corviknight and Whirpool Alomomola into setup fodder.
  • Earthquake hits Kingambit, Garganacl, and Iron Treads, which can otherwise survive hits and wear down Roaring Moon.
  • Taunt stops defensive Pokemon like Haze Toxapex, Will-O-Wisp Skeledirge, and Whirlwind Ting-Lu from dealing with Roaring Moon, making it devastating against bulkier teams if positioned right.
  • Hyper offense leads such as Glimmora, Froslass, and Grimmsnarl all give Roaring Moon good support to break through a team more easily.
  • Choice Scarf Great Tusk, Tera Fire Koraidon, and Tera Fairy Miraidon can all be used to bait Chien-Pao and take it out, helping Roaring Moon greatly, as it is one of the most reliable revenge killers that can be used against it.
  • On bulkier teams, Roaring Moon requires teammates that can switch into Ice-type moves from Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle, making Toxapex and specially defensive Corviknight great partners. The latter can also pivot with U-turn, giving Roaring Moon more chances to set up on defensive Pokemon.

Full Moon (Choice Band).description:
• Earthquake lets Roaring Moon break past Pokemon that would otherwise check it, like Garganacl, Toxapex, and especially Kingambit.
  • Iron Head lets Roaring Moon hit Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Tera Fairy Garganacl and Skeledirge super effectively.
  • U-turn lets Roaring Moon generate offensive momentum for its team and is especially useful against targets Roaring Moon scares out, like Skeledirge without Tera Fairy and Gholdengo.
  • The given EVs and a Jolly nature ensure Roaring Moon's Speed is boosted in sunlight, letting it get the jump on crucial threats like unboosted non-Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon and threaten them with its STAB Dragon Claw. The remaining 36 Special Defense EVs improve Roaring Moon's chances to survive Iron Bundle's Ice Beam after Stealth Rock while giving it a chance to survive Overheat in sun from Modest Choice Specs Chi-Yu.
  • Tera Dark strengthens Roaring Moon's Crunch to the point where it always 2HKOs physically defensive Corviknight and always 3HKOs Dondozo while easing predictions with Earthquake against Garganacl.
  • Tera Steel lets Roaring Moon resist otherwise super effective Ice-, Fairy-, and Dragon-type attacks from the likes of Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, Koraidon, and Miraidon. Tera Steel also powers up Roaring Moon's Iron Head.
  • Tera Fairy allows Roaring Moon to resist Fighting-type attacks while becoming immune to Dragon-type attacks, letting it defeat Koraidon and Iron Valiant, both of which outspeed and threaten to OHKO Roaring Moon otherwise.
  • Roaring Moon loves the support of Koraidon, as it activates Roaring Moon's Protosynthesis via Orichalcum Pulse and reliably threatens Pokemon such as Koraidon, Miraidon, and Ice-types like Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle. In return, Roaring Moon threatens non-Terastallized Skeledirge.
  • Koraidon and Roaring Moon both struggle with defensive Great Tusk, so they can team up with Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao, which threaten all Great Tusk sets. Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao also threaten Koraidon and Miraidon, with Iron Bundle naturally outspeeding non-Choice Scarf variants and Chien-Pao threatening them with priority Ice Shard.
  • Defensive Great Tusk and Ting-Lu also work well with Roaring Moon, as they can set up entry hazards for Roaring Moon's team and check Koraidon and Miraidon, respectively. Great Tusk in particular can use Rapid Spin, giving Roaring Moon more opportunities to switch in, while Ting-Lu can phaze threatening boosters like Espathra with Whirlwind and set up Spikes.
  • Specially defensive Corviknight can check Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, both of which outspeed and threaten Roaring Moon, and can Defog hazards away, giving Roaring Moon more opportunities to switch in.
  • Roaring Moon can easily pivot into Chi-Yu, which takes advantage of the sun set by Koraidon and threatens walls like Great Tusk, Corviknight, Ting-Lu, and Terastallized Skeledirge.
  • Gholdengo also makes for a decent partner, as not only does it have perfect defensive synergy with Roaring Moon, but it can also reliably block all common forms of hazard removal. This allows Roaring Moon’s team to keep up hazards, in particular Spikes, for it to eventually break down walls.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Koraidon is one of the best revenge killers in Ubers thanks to its high Attack and Speed.
  • Low Kick is usually preferred over Collision Course due to it hitting most Pokemon harder in the heavy Ubers tier.
  • Dragon Claw is a reliable Dragon-type STAB move, while Outrage usually 2HKOes Skeledirge. This can force it to use Tera Fairy, which Zacian-C can take advantage of.
  • U-turn allows Koraidon to take advantage of predictable switches to Skeledirge or Groudon and bring in dangerous wallbreakers, such as Flutter Mane, Chi-Yu, Walking Wake, or Kyogre. Be careful not to use U-turn too much when facing Rocky Helmet users like Toxapex.
  • Flare Blitz hits targets like Arceus-Fairy hard, especially when boosted by Tera Fire. Tera Fire also prevents burns from Skeledirge or Giratina-O and gives Koraidon a useful Fairy resistance.
  • Tera Steel is a good option for the myriad of resistances it brings, most notably Normal for E-Killer Arceus, Dragon for opposing Koraidon or Miraidon, and Fairy against Arceus-Fairy or Zacian-C.
  • As a revenge killer, Koraidon provides numerous advantages compared to others, such as having high Defense and Fighting-type STAB moves to take on E-Killer Arceus, and attacking physically lets it heavily damage Calm Mind Arceus formes.
  • It's nigh on impossible for this Koraidon to break past Skeledirge, Toxapex, or Dondozo reliably, so pairing Koraidon with strong wallbreakers that can take advantage of U-turn is a must.
  • Arceus-Fairy takes on Koraidon well and doesn't mind U-turn, so checks to Arceus-Fairy such as Skeledirge, Zacian-C, and Clodsire are good partners.
  • Flare Blitz recoil, Rocky Helmet damage, and entry hazards can quickly pile up damage on this Koraidon, so having a solid defensive core is recommended so you don't have to rely on Koraidon's revenge killing as much.

Scale Shot.description:
• Koraidon is the single best sweeper in the tier thanks to its incredible coverage and naturally high Attack thanks to Orichalcum Pulse. Bulk Up is an alternative to Swords Dance that negates Scale Shot's Defense drop, albeit weaker. Scale Shot is a powerful Dragon-type attack, especially when paired with Loaded Dice, that gives Koraidon a way to outspeed Zacian-C while having good odds to 2HKO Skeledirge and Toxapex. Flare Blitz, when boosted by Koraidon's sun, can break through Arceus-Fairy, Zacian-C, and Flutter Mane. Low Kick threatens Arceus while providing strong neutral coverage.
  • Tera Ghost offsets Koraidon's Defense stat drop, letting it avoid being revenge killed by Arceus. Tera Fire, however, allows Koraidon to flip the matchup on Arceus-Fairy and Zacian-C while increasing Flare Blitz's power and making it immune to Will-O-Wisp.
  • Koraidon fits best on offense teams, where it can leverage its incredible wallbreaking power to support its other teammates. Koraidon can pressure physical walls such as Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Toxapex, so Pokemon that can take advantage of this, such as Zacian-C and Arceus, are good partners. Flutter Mane is another good partner for cleaning up after Koraidon breaks through defensive Arceus formes and Zacian-C. Koraidon's Scale Shot creates situations where Fairy-type Pokemon such as Zacian-C, Arceus-Fairy, and Flutter Mane may switch into it directly; therefore, predicting when these pivots come in opens up Koraidon late-game.
  • Try to bait out Terastallization before using Koraidon, as Tera Fairy Pokemon such as Kyogre can limit Koraidon from sweeping and force it out. Kyogre in particular is also a temporary check to Koraidon thanks to Drizzle deactivating Koraidon’s ability. Scale Shot's Defense drop makes Koraidon vulnerable to priority such as Arceus's Extreme Speed and Kingambit's Sucker Punch, so teammates that can pivot into these attacks, like Landorus-T and Zacian-C, are appreciated. Since Scale Shot draws in Fairy-types such as Zacian-C, Arceus-Fairy, and Flutter Mane, checks to them such as Landorus-T and Zacian-C, respectively, are appreciated.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band Koraidon has no reliable switch-ins, thus making it one of the most powerful wallbreakers in the tier.
  • Low Kick makes for a strong STAB move with few drawbacks, as it often sports high Base Power in the Ubers tier. Close Combat is the preferred Fighting-type STAB move when running Tera Fighting, as it has a chance to 2HKO both Toxapex, which takes little from Low Kick, and most Arceus-Fairy sets outright.
  • Dragon Claw usually 2HKOes Skeledirge and is a reliable Dragon-type STAB move, so it tends to be preferred over Outrage. Outrage does sport overwhelming power and can 2HKO Toxapex and Alomomola, which Dragon Claw cannot do without entry hazard support. This is particularly notable for Tera Steel sets, which may otherwise lack enough breaking power.
  • Flare Blitz is a very strong move under the sun and becomes incredibly powerful when boosted by Tera Fire, to the point that it even 2HKOes Fire-resistant Pokemon like Skeledirge and Toxapex. Tera Fire has the additional benefit of granting a Fairy resistance and a burn immunity.
  • While not providing any boost in offensive power, Tera Steel offers several useful resistances to Fairy, Ice, and Dragon, which can help Koraidon take on Pokemon like Zacian-C, Miraidon, Arceus-Fairy, and Chien-Pao.
  • Choice Band Koraidon is an insanely powerful wallbreaker that can break past all of its normal checks and switch-ins. However, it tends to be worn down easily due to being vulnerable to all entry hazards and often taking Rocky Helmet damage and Flare Blitz recoil. Thus, it pairs best with teammates like Zacian-C, which can clean up after Koraidon has broken down the main defensive core.
